3289        // GrP fixme be specific about d_name?
3290        POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG2, RES);
3291     }
3292     
3293     
3294     PRE(getdirentries64)
3295     {
3296        PRINT("getdirentries64(%ld, %#lx, %lu, %#lx)", ARG1, ARG2, ARG3, ARG4);
3297        PRE_REG_READ4(vki_ssize_t, "getdirentries", 
3298                      int,fd, char *,buf, vki_size_t,nbytes, vki_off_t *,basep);
3299        PRE_MEM_WRITE("getdirentries(position)", ARG4, sizeof(vki_off_t));
3300        PRE_MEM_WRITE("getdirentries(buf)", ARG2, ARG3);
3301     }
3302     POST(getdirentries64) 
3303     {
3304        POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG4, sizeof(vki_off_t));
3305        // GrP fixme be specific about d_name? (fixme copied from 32 bit version)
3306        POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG2, RES);
3307     }
3308     
3309     
3310     PRE(statfs64)
3311     {
3312        PRINT("statfs64 ( %#lx(%s), %#lx )",ARG1,(char *)ARG1,ARG2);
3313        PRE_REG_READ2(long, "statfs64", const char *, path, struct statfs64 *, buf);
3314        PRE_MEM_RASCIIZ( "statfs64(path)", ARG1 );
3315        PRE_MEM_WRITE( "statfs64(buf)", ARG2, sizeof(struct vki_statfs64) );
3316     }
3317     POST(statfs64)
3318     {
3319        POST_MEM_WRITE( ARG2, sizeof(struct vki_statfs64) );
3320     }
3321     
3322     
3323     PRE(fstatfs64)
3324     {
3325        PRINT("fstatfs64 ( %ld, %#lx )",ARG1,ARG2);
3326        PRE_REG_READ2(long, "fstatfs64",
3327                      unsigned int, fd, struct statfs *, buf);
3328        PRE_MEM_WRITE( "fstatfs64(buf)", ARG2, sizeof(struct vki_statfs64) );
3329     }
3330     POST(fstatfs64)
3331     {
3332        POST_MEM_WRITE( ARG2, sizeof(struct vki_statfs64) );
3333     }
3334     
3335     PRE(csops)
3336     {
3337        PRINT("csops ( %ld, %#lx, %#lx, %lu )", ARG1, ARG2, ARG3, ARG4);
3338        PRE_REG_READ4(int, "csops",
3339                      vki_pid_t, pid, uint32_t, ops,
3340                      void *, useraddr, vki_size_t, usersize);
3341     
3342        PRE_MEM_WRITE( "csops(useraddr)", ARG3, ARG4 );
3343     
3344        // If the pid is ours, don't mark the program as KILL or HARD
3345        // Maybe we should keep track of this for later calls to STATUS
3346        if (!ARG1 || VG_(getpid)() == ARG1) {
3347           switch (ARG2) {
3348           case VKI_CS_OPS_MARKINVALID:
3349           case VKI_CS_OPS_MARKHARD:
3350           case VKI_CS_OPS_MARKKILL:
3351              SET_STATUS_Success(0);
3352           }
3353        }
3354     }
3355     POST(csops)
3356     {
3357        POST_MEM_WRITE( ARG3, ARG4 );
3358     }
3359     
3360     PRE(auditon)
3361     {
3362        PRINT("auditon ( %ld, %#lx, %ld )", ARG1, ARG2, ARG3);
3363        PRE_REG_READ3(int,"auditon", 
3364                      int,"cmd", void*,"data", unsigned int,"length");
3365     
3366        switch (ARG1) {
3367     
3368        case VKI_A_SETPOLICY: 
3369        case VKI_A_SETKMASK:
3370        case VKI_A_SETQCTRL:
3371        case VKI_A_SETCOND:
3372        case VKI_A_SETCLASS:
3373        case VKI_A_SETPMASK:
3374        case VKI_A_SETFSIZE:
3375     #if DARWIN_VERS >= DARWIN_10_6
3376        case VKI_A_SENDTRIGGER:
3377     #endif
3378           // kernel reads data..data+length
3379           PRE_MEM_READ("auditon(data)", ARG2, ARG3);
3380           break;
3381     
3382        case VKI_A_GETKMASK:
3383        case VKI_A_GETPOLICY:
3384        case VKI_A_GETQCTRL:
3385        case VKI_A_GETFSIZE:
3386        case VKI_A_GETCOND:
3387           // kernel writes data..data+length
3388           // GrP fixme be precise about what gets written
3389           PRE_MEM_WRITE("auditon(data)", ARG2, ARG3);
3390           break;
3391     
3392     
3393        case VKI_A_GETCLASS:
3394        case VKI_A_GETPINFO:
3395        case VKI_A_GETPINFO_ADDR:
3396     #if DARWIN_VERS >= DARWIN_10_6
3397        case VKI_A_GETSINFO_ADDR:
3398     #endif
3399           // kernel reads and writes data..data+length
3400           // GrP fixme be precise about what gets read and written
3401           PRE_MEM_READ("auditon(data)", ARG2, ARG3);
3402           PRE_MEM_WRITE("auditon(data)", ARG2, ARG3);
3403           break;
3404     
3405        case VKI_A_SETKAUDIT:
3406        case VKI_A_SETSTAT:
3407        case VKI_A_SETUMASK:
3408        case VKI_A_SETSMASK:
3409        case VKI_A_GETKAUDIT:
3410        case VKI_A_GETCWD:
3411        case VKI_A_GETCAR:
3412        case VKI_A_GETSTAT:
3413           // unimplemented on darwin
3414           break;
3415     
3416        default:
3417           VG_(message)(Vg_UserMsg, "UNKNOWN auditon cmd %ld", ARG1);
3418           break;
3419        }
3420     }
3421     POST(auditon)
3422     {
3423        switch (ARG1) {
3424     
3425        case VKI_A_SETPOLICY: 
3426        case VKI_A_SETKMASK:
3427        case VKI_A_SETQCTRL:
3428        case VKI_A_SETCOND:
3429        case VKI_A_SETCLASS:
3430        case VKI_A_SETPMASK:
3431        case VKI_A_SETFSIZE:
3432     #if DARWIN_VERS >= DARWIN_10_6
3433        case VKI_A_SENDTRIGGER:
3434     #endif
3435           // kernel reads data..data+length
3436           break;
3437     
3438        case VKI_A_GETKMASK:
3439        case VKI_A_GETPOLICY:
3440        case VKI_A_GETQCTRL:
3441        case VKI_A_GETFSIZE:
3442        case VKI_A_GETCOND:
3443           // kernel writes data..data+length
3444           // GrP fixme be precise about what gets written
3445           POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG2, ARG3);
3446           break;
3447     
3448     
3449        case VKI_A_GETCLASS:
3450        case VKI_A_GETPINFO:
3451        case VKI_A_GETPINFO_ADDR:
3452     #if DARWIN_VERS >= DARWIN_10_6
3453        case VKI_A_GETSINFO_ADDR:
3454     #endif
3455           // kernel reads and writes data..data+length
3456           // GrP fixme be precise about what gets read and written
3457           POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG2, ARG3);
3458           break;
3459     
3460        case VKI_A_SETKAUDIT:
3461        case VKI_A_SETSTAT:
3462        case VKI_A_SETUMASK:
3463        case VKI_A_SETSMASK:
3464        case VKI_A_GETKAUDIT:
3465        case VKI_A_GETCWD:
3466        case VKI_A_GETCAR:
3467        case VKI_A_GETSTAT:
3468           // unimplemented on darwin
3469           break;
3470     
3471        default:
3472           break;
3473        }    
3474     }
3475     
3476     
3477     PRE(mmap)
3478     {
3479        // SysRes r;
3480     
3481     #if VG_WORDSIZE == 4
3482        PRINT("mmap ( %#lx, %lu, %ld, %ld, %ld, %lld )",
3483              ARG1, ARG2, ARG3, ARG4, ARG5, LOHI64(ARG6, ARG7) );
3484        PRE_REG_READ7(Addr, "mmap",
3485                      Addr,start, vki_size_t,length, int,prot, int,flags, int,fd, 
3486                      unsigned long,offset_hi, unsigned long,offset_lo);
3487        // GrP fixme V mmap and kernel mach_msg collided once - don't use 
3488        // V's mechanism for now
3489        // r = ML_(generic_PRE_sys_mmap)( tid, ARG1, ARG2, ARG3, ARG4, ARG5, 
3490        // (Off64T)LOHI64(ARG6, ARG7) );
3491     #else
3492        PRINT("mmap ( %#lx, %lu, %ld, %ld, %ld, %ld )",
3493              ARG1, ARG2, ARG3, ARG4, ARG5, ARG6 );
3494        PRE_REG_READ6(long, "mmap",
3495                      Addr,start, vki_size_t,length, int,prot, int,flags, int,fd, 
3496                      Off64T,offset);
3497        // r = ML_(generic_PRE_sys_mmap)( tid, ARG1, ARG2, ARG3, ARG4, ARG5, ARG6 );
3498     
3499     #endif
3500     
3501        // SET_STATUS_from_SysRes(r);
3502     }
3503     
3504     POST(mmap)
3505     {
3506        if (RES != -1) {
3507           ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mmap)(RES, ARG2, ARG3, ARG4, ARG5, ARG6);
3508           // Try to load symbols from the region
3509           VG_(di_notify_mmap)( (Addr)RES, False/*allow_SkFileV*/ );
3510        }
3511     }
3512     
3513     
3514     PRE(__sysctl)
3515     {
3516        PRINT( "__sysctl ( %#lx, %ld, %#lx, %#lx, %#lx, %ld )", 
3517               ARG1, ARG2, ARG3, ARG4, ARG5, ARG6 );
3518     
3519        PRE_REG_READ6(int, "__sysctl", int*, name, unsigned int, namelen, 
3520                      void*, oldp, vki_size_t *, oldlenp, 
3521                      void*, newp, vki_size_t *, newlenp);
3522     
3523        PRE_MEM_READ("sysctl(name)", ARG1, ARG2);  // reads name[0..namelen-1]
3524        if (ARG4) {
3525           // writes *ARG4
3526           PRE_MEM_WRITE("sysctl(oldlenp)", ARG4, sizeof(size_t));
3527           if (ARG3) {
3528              // also reads *ARG4, and writes as much as ARG3[0..ARG4-1]
3529              PRE_MEM_READ("sysctl(oldlenp)", ARG4, sizeof(size_t));
3530              PRE_MEM_WRITE("sysctl(oldp)", ARG3, *(size_t *)ARG4);
3531           }
3532        }
3533        if (ARG5) {
3534           PRE_MEM_READ("sysctl(newp)", ARG5, ARG6);
3535        }
3536     
3537        if (VG_(clo_trace_syscalls)) {
3538           unsigned int i;
3539           int *name = (int *)ARG1;
3540           VG_(printf)(" mib: [ ");
3541           for (i = 0; i < ARG2; i++) {
3542              VG_(printf)("%d ", name[i]);
3543           }
3544           VG_(printf)("]");
3545        }
3546     
3547        // GrP fixme intercept KERN_PROCARGS and KERN_PROC_PID for our pid
3548        // (executable path and arguments and environment
3549     
3550        {
3551           // Intercept sysctl(kern.usrstack). The kernel's reply would be
3552           // Valgrind's stack, not the client's stack.
3553           // GrP fixme kern_usrstack64
3554           if (ARG1  &&  ARG2 == 2  &&  
3555               ((int *)ARG1)[0] == VKI_CTL_KERN  &&  
3556     #if VG_WORDSIZE == 4
3557               ((int *)ARG1)[1] == VKI_KERN_USRSTACK32
3558     #else
3559               ((int *)ARG1)[1] == VKI_KERN_USRSTACK64
3560     #endif
3561               )
3562           {
3563              if (ARG5/*newp*/  ||  ARG6/*newlen*/) {
3564                 SET_STATUS_Failure(VKI_EPERM); // USRSTACK is read-only
3565              } else {
3566                 Addr *oldp = (Addr *)ARG3;
3567                 size_t *oldlenp = (size_t *)ARG4;
3568                 if (oldlenp) {
3569                    Addr stack_end = VG_(clstk_end)+1;
3570                    size_t oldlen = *oldlenp;
3571                    // always return actual size
3572                    *oldlenp = sizeof(Addr);
3573                    if (oldp  &&  oldlen >= sizeof(Addr)) {
3574                       // oldp is big enough
3575                       // copy value and return 0
3576                       *oldp = stack_end;
3577                       SET_STATUS_Success(0);
3578                    } else {
3579                       // oldp isn't big enough
3580                       // copy as much as possible and return ENOMEM
3581                       if (oldp) VG_(memcpy)(oldp, &stack_end, oldlen);
3582                       SET_STATUS_Failure(VKI_ENOMEM);
3583                    }
3584                 }
3585              }
3586           }
3587        }
3588     
3589        if (!SUCCESS  &&  !FAILURE) {
3590           // Don't set SfPostOnFail if we've already handled it locally.
3591           *flags |= SfPostOnFail;
3592        }
3593     }
3594     
3595     POST(__sysctl)
3596     {
3597        if (SUCCESS  ||  ERR == VKI_ENOMEM) {
3598           // sysctl can write truncated data and return VKI_ENOMEM
3599           if (ARG4) {
3600              POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG4, sizeof(size_t));
3601           }
3602           if (ARG3  &&  ARG4) {
3603              POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG3, *(size_t *)ARG4);
3604           }
3605        }
3606     }
3607     
3608     
3609     PRE(sigpending)
3610     {
3611        PRINT( "sigpending ( %#lx )", ARG1 );
3612        PRE_REG_READ1(long, "sigpending", vki_sigset_t *, set);
3613        PRE_MEM_WRITE( "sigpending(set)", ARG1, sizeof(vki_sigset_t));
3614     }
3615     POST(sigpending)
3616     {
3617        POST_MEM_WRITE( ARG1, sizeof(vki_sigset_t) ) ;
3618     }
3619     
3620     
3621     PRE(sigprocmask)
3622     {
3623        UWord arg1;
3624        PRINT("sigprocmask ( %ld, %#lx, %#lx )", ARG1, ARG2, ARG3);
3625        PRE_REG_READ3(long, "sigprocmask",
3626                      int, how, vki_sigset_t *, set, vki_sigset_t *, oldset);
3627        if (ARG2 != 0)
3628           PRE_MEM_READ( "sigprocmask(set)", ARG2, sizeof(vki_sigset_t));
3629        if (ARG3 != 0)
3630           PRE_MEM_WRITE( "sigprocmask(oldset)", ARG3, sizeof(vki_sigset_t));
3631     
3632        /* Massage ARG1 ('how').  If ARG2 (the new mask) is NULL then the
3633           value of 'how' is irrelevant, and it appears that Darwin's libc
3634           passes zero, which is not equal to any of
3635           SIG_{BLOCK,UNBLOCK,SETMASK}.  This causes
3636           VG_(do_sys_sigprocmask) to complain, since it checks the 'how'
3637           value independently of the other args.  Solution: in this case,
3638           simply pass a valid (but irrelevant) value for 'how'. */
3639        /* Also, in this case the new set is passed to the kernel by
3640           reference, not value, as in some other sigmask related Darwin
3641           syscalls. */
3642        arg1 = ARG1;
3643        if (ARG2 == 0  /* the new-set is NULL */
3644            && ARG1 != VKI_SIG_BLOCK
3645            && ARG1 != VKI_SIG_UNBLOCK && ARG1 != VKI_SIG_SETMASK) {
3646           arg1 = VKI_SIG_SETMASK;
3647        }
3648        SET_STATUS_from_SysRes(
3649           VG_(do_sys_sigprocmask) ( tid, arg1, (vki_sigset_t*)ARG2,
3650                                                (vki_sigset_t*)ARG3 )
3651        );
3652     
3653        if (SUCCESS)
3654           *flags |= SfPollAfter;
3655     }
3656     
3657     POST(sigprocmask)
3658     {
3659        vg_assert(SUCCESS);
3660        if (RES == 0 && ARG3 != 0)
3661           POST_MEM_WRITE( ARG3, sizeof(vki_sigset_t));
3662     }
3663     
3664     
3665     PRE(sigsuspend)
3666     {
3667        /* Just hand this off to the kernel.  Is that really correct?  And
3668           shouldn't we at least set SfPollAfter?  These questions apply to
3669           all the Linux versions too. */
3670        /* I think the first arg is the 32-bit signal mask (by value), and
3671           the other two args are ignored. */
3672        *flags |= SfMayBlock;
3673        PRINT("sigsuspend ( mask=0x%08lx )", ARG1 );
3674        PRE_REG_READ1(int, "sigsuspend", int, sigmask);
3675     }
3676     
3677     
3678     /* Be careful about the 4th arg, since that is a uint64_t.  Hence 64-
3679        and 32-bit wrappers are different.
3680     
3681        ARG5 and ARG6 (buffer, buffersize) specify a buffer start and
3682        length in the usual way.  I have seen values NULL, 0 passed in some
3683        cases.  I left the calls to PRE_MEM_WRITE/READ unconditional on the
3684        basis that they don't do anything if the length is zero, so it's OK
3685        for the buffer pointer to be NULL in that case (meaning they don't
3686        complain).
3687     
3688        int proc_info(int32_t callnum, int32_t pid,
3689                      uint32_t flavor, uint64_t arg,
3690                      user_addr_t buffer, int32_t buffersize)
3691     */
3692     #if DARWIN_VERS >= DARWIN_10_6
3693     PRE(proc_info)
3694     {
3695     #if VG_WORDSIZE == 4
3696        PRINT("proc_info(%d, %d, %u, %llu, %#lx, %d)",
3697              (Int)ARG1, (Int)ARG2, (UInt)ARG3, LOHI64(ARG4,ARG5), ARG6, (Int)ARG7);
3698        PRE_REG_READ7(int, "proc_info",
3699                      int, callnum, int, pid, unsigned int, flavor,
3700                      vki_uint32_t, arg_low32,
3701                      vki_uint32_t, arg_high32,
3702                      void*, buffer, int, buffersize);
3703        PRE_MEM_WRITE("proc_info(buffer)", ARG6, ARG7);
3704     #else
3705        PRINT("proc_info(%d, %d, %u, %llu, %#lx, %d)",
3706              (Int)ARG1, (Int)ARG2, (UInt)ARG3, (ULong)ARG4, ARG5, (Int)ARG6);
3707        PRE_REG_READ6(int, "proc_info",
3708                      int, callnum, int, pid, unsigned int, flavor,
3709                      unsigned long long int, arg,
3710                      void*, buffer, int, buffersize);
3711        PRE_MEM_WRITE("proc_info(buffer)", ARG5, ARG6);
3712     #endif
3713     }
3714     
3715     POST(proc_info)
3716     {
3717     #if VG_WORDSIZE == 4
3718        vg_assert(SUCCESS);
3719        POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG6, ARG7);
3720     #else
3721        vg_assert(SUCCESS);
3722        POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG5, ARG6);
3723     #endif
3724     }
3725     
3726     #endif /* DARWIN_VERS >= DARWIN_10_6 */
3727     
3728     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
3729        aio_*
3730        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
3731     
3732     // We must record the aiocbp for each aio_read() in a table so that when
3733     // aio_return() is called we can mark the memory written asynchronously by
3734     // aio_read() as having been written.  We don't have to do this for
3735     // aio_write().  See bug 197227 for more details.
3736     static OSet* aiocbp_table = NULL;
3737     static Bool aio_init_done = False;
3738     
3739     static void aio_init(void)
3740     {
3741        aiocbp_table = VG_(OSetWord_Create)(VG_(malloc), "syswrap.aio", VG_(free));
3742        aio_init_done = True;
3743     }
3744     
3745     static Bool was_a_successful_aio_read = False;
3746     
3747     PRE(aio_return)
3748     {
3749        struct vki_aiocb* aiocbp = (struct vki_aiocb*)ARG1;
3750        // This assumes that the kernel looks at the struct pointer, but not the
3751        // contents of the struct.
3752        PRINT( "aio_return ( %#lx )", ARG1 );
3753        PRE_REG_READ1(long, "aio_return", struct vki_aiocb*, aiocbp);
3754     
3755        if (!aio_init_done) aio_init();
3756        was_a_successful_aio_read = VG_(OSetWord_Remove)(aiocbp_table, (UWord)aiocbp);
3757     }
3758     POST(aio_return)
3759     {
3760        // If we found the aiocbp in our own table it must have been an aio_read(),
3761        // so mark the buffer as written.  If we didn't find it, it must have been
3762        // an aio_write() or a bogus aio_return() (eg. a second one on the same
3763        // aiocbp).  Either way, the buffer won't have been written so we don't
3764        // have to mark the buffer as written.
3765        if (was_a_successful_aio_read) {
3766           struct vki_aiocb* aiocbp = (struct vki_aiocb*)ARG1;
3767           POST_MEM_WRITE((Addr)aiocbp->aio_buf, aiocbp->aio_nbytes);
3768           was_a_successful_aio_read = False;
3769        }
3770     }
3771     
3772     PRE(aio_suspend)
3773     {
3774        // This assumes that the kernel looks at the struct pointers in the list,
3775        // but not the contents of the structs.
3776        PRINT( "aio_suspend ( %#lx )", ARG1 );
3777        PRE_REG_READ3(long, "aio_suspend",
3778                      const struct vki_aiocb *, aiocbp, int, nent,
3779                      const struct vki_timespec *, timeout);
3780        if (ARG2 > 0)
3781           PRE_MEM_READ("aio_suspend(list)", ARG1, ARG2 * sizeof(struct vki_aiocb *));
3782        if (ARG3)
3783           PRE_MEM_READ ("aio_suspend(timeout)", ARG3, sizeof(struct vki_timespec));
3784     }
3785     
3786     PRE(aio_error)
3787     {
3788        // This assumes that the kernel looks at the struct pointer, but not the
3789        // contents of the struct.
3790        PRINT( "aio_error ( %#lx )", ARG1 );
3791        PRE_REG_READ1(long, "aio_error", struct vki_aiocb*, aiocbp);
3792     }
3793     
3794     PRE(aio_read)
3795     {
3796        struct vki_aiocb* aiocbp = (struct vki_aiocb*)ARG1;
3797     
3798        PRINT( "aio_read ( %#lx )", ARG1 );
3799        PRE_REG_READ1(long, "aio_read", struct vki_aiocb*, aiocbp);
3800        PRE_MEM_READ( "aio_read(aiocbp)", ARG1, sizeof(struct vki_aiocb));
3801     
3802        if (ML_(safe_to_deref)(aiocbp, sizeof(struct vki_aiocb))) {
3803           if (ML_(fd_allowed)(aiocbp->aio_fildes, "aio_read", tid, /*isNewFd*/False)) {
3804              PRE_MEM_WRITE("aio_read(aiocbp->aio_buf)",
3805                            (Addr)aiocbp->aio_buf, aiocbp->aio_nbytes);
3806           } else {
3807              SET_STATUS_Failure( VKI_EBADF );
3808           }
3809        } else {
3810           SET_STATUS_Failure( VKI_EINVAL );
3811        }
3812     }
3813     POST(aio_read)
3814     {
3815        // We have to record the fact that there is an asynchronous read request
3816        // pending.  When a successful aio_return() occurs for this aiocb, then we
3817        // will mark the memory as having been defined.
3818        struct vki_aiocb* aiocbp = (struct vki_aiocb*)ARG1;
3819        if (!aio_init_done) aio_init();
3820        // aiocbp shouldn't already be in the table -- if it was a dup, the kernel
3821        // should have caused the aio_read() to fail and we shouldn't have reached
3822        // here.
3823        VG_(OSetWord_Insert)(aiocbp_table, (UWord)aiocbp);
3824     }
3825     
3826     PRE(aio_write)
3827     {
3828        struct vki_aiocb* aiocbp = (struct vki_aiocb*)ARG1;
3829     
3830        PRINT( "aio_write ( %#lx )", ARG1 );
3831        PRE_REG_READ1(long, "aio_write", struct vki_aiocb*, aiocbp);
3832        PRE_MEM_READ( "aio_write(aiocbp)", ARG1, sizeof(struct vki_aiocb));
3833     
3834        if (ML_(safe_to_deref)(aiocbp, sizeof(struct vki_aiocb))) {
3835           if (ML_(fd_allowed)(aiocbp->aio_fildes, "aio_write", tid, /*isNewFd*/False)) {
3836              PRE_MEM_READ("aio_write(aiocbp->aio_buf)",
3837                           (Addr)aiocbp->aio_buf, aiocbp->aio_nbytes);
3838           } else {
3839              SET_STATUS_Failure( VKI_EBADF );
3840           }
3841        } else {
3842           SET_STATUS_Failure( VKI_EINVAL );
3843        }
3844     }
3845     
3846     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
3847        mach_msg: formatted messages
3848        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
3849     
3850     static size_t desc_size(mach_msg_descriptor_t *desc)
3851     {
3852        switch (desc->type.type) {
3853        case MACH_MSG_PORT_DESCRIPTOR:          return sizeof(desc->port);
3854        case MACH_MSG_OOL_DESCRIPTOR:           return sizeof(desc->out_of_line);
3855        case MACH_MSG_OOL_VOLATILE_DESCRIPTOR:  return sizeof(desc->out_of_line);
3856        case MACH_MSG_OOL_PORTS_DESCRIPTOR:     return sizeof(desc->ool_ports);
3857        default: 
3858           VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN mach message descriptor %d\n", desc->type.type);
3859           return sizeof(desc->type); // guess
3860        }
3861     }
3862     
3863     
3864     static void assign_port_names(mach_msg_ool_ports_descriptor_t *desc, 
3865                                   const char *name)
3866     {
3867        mach_msg_size_t i;
3868        mach_port_t *ports = (mach_port_t *)desc->address;
3869        for (i = 0; i < desc->count; i++) {
3870           assign_port_name(ports[i], name);
3871        }
3872     }
3873     
3874     
3875     static void import_complex_message(ThreadId tid, mach_msg_header_t *mh)
3876     {
3877        mach_msg_body_t *body;
3878        mach_msg_size_t count, i;
3879        uint8_t *p;
3880        mach_msg_descriptor_t *desc;
3881        
3882        vg_assert(mh->msgh_bits & MACH_MSGH_BITS_COMPLEX);
3883        
3884        body = (mach_msg_body_t *)(mh+1);
3885        count = body->msgh_descriptor_count;
3886        p = (uint8_t *)(body+1);
3887        
3888        for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
3889           desc = (mach_msg_descriptor_t *)p;
3890           p += desc_size(desc);
3891           
3892           switch (desc->type.type) {
3893           case MACH_MSG_PORT_DESCRIPTOR:
3894              // single port
3895              record_unnamed_port(tid, desc->port.name, -1);
3896              record_port_insert_rights(desc->port.name, desc->port.disposition);
3897              PRINT("got port %s;\n", name_for_port(desc->port.name));
3898              break;
3899     
3900           case MACH_MSG_OOL_DESCRIPTOR:
3901           case MACH_MSG_OOL_VOLATILE_DESCRIPTOR:
3902              // out-of-line memory - map it
3903              // GrP fixme how is VOLATILE different? do we care?
3904              // GrP fixme do other flags tell us anything? assume shared for now
3905              // GrP fixme more SF_ flags marking mach_msg memory might be nice
3906              // GrP fixme protection
3907              if (desc->out_of_line.size > 0) {
3908                 Addr start = VG_PGROUNDDN((Addr)desc->out_of_line.address);
3909                 Addr end = VG_PGROUNDUP((Addr)desc->out_of_line.address + 
3910                                         (Addr)desc->out_of_line.size);
3911                 PRINT("got ool mem %p..%#lx;\n", desc->out_of_line.address, 
3912                       (Addr)desc->out_of_line.address+desc->out_of_line.size);
3913     
3914                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mmap)(
3915                    start, end - start, VKI_PROT_READ|VKI_PROT_WRITE, 
3916                    VKI_MAP_PRIVATE, -1, 0);
3917              }
3918              // GrP fixme mark only un-rounded part as initialized 
3919              break;
3920     
3921           case MACH_MSG_OOL_PORTS_DESCRIPTOR:
3922              // out-of-line array of ports - map it
3923              // GrP fixme see fixmes above
3924              PRINT("got %d ool ports %p..%#lx", desc->ool_ports.count, desc->ool_ports.address, (Addr)desc->ool_ports.address+desc->ool_ports.count*sizeof(mach_port_t));
3925     
3926              if (desc->ool_ports.count > 0) {
3927                 Addr start = VG_PGROUNDDN((Addr)desc->ool_ports.address);
3928                 Addr end = VG_PGROUNDUP((Addr)desc->ool_ports.address + desc->ool_ports.count * sizeof(mach_port_t));
3929                 mach_port_t *ports = (mach_port_t *)desc->ool_ports.address;
3930     
3931                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mmap)(
3932                    start, end - start, VKI_PROT_READ|VKI_PROT_WRITE, 
3933                    VKI_MAP_PRIVATE, -1, 0);
3934     
3935                 PRINT(":");
3936                 for (i = 0; i < desc->ool_ports.count; i++) {
3937                    record_unnamed_port(tid, ports[i], -1);
3938                    record_port_insert_rights(ports[i], desc->port.disposition);
3939                    PRINT(" %s", name_for_port(ports[i]));
3940                 }
3941              }
3942              PRINT(";\n");
3943              break;
3944     
3945           default:
3946              VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN Mach descriptor type %u!\n", desc->type.type);
3947              break;
3948           }
3949        }
3950     }
3951     
3952     
3953     static void pre_port_desc_read(ThreadId tid, mach_msg_port_descriptor_t *desc2)
3954     {
3955     #pragma pack(4)
3956        struct {
3957           mach_port_t name;
3958           mach_msg_size_t pad1;
3959           uint16_t pad2;
3960           uint8_t disposition;
3961           uint8_t type;
3962        } *desc = (void*)desc2;
3963     #pragma pack()
3964     
3965        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.port.name",        desc->name);
3966        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.port.disposition", desc->disposition);
3967        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.port.type",        desc->type);
3968     }
3969     
3970     
3971     static void pre_ool_desc_read(ThreadId tid, mach_msg_ool_descriptor_t *desc2)
3972     {
3973     #pragma pack(4)
3974        struct {
3975           Addr address;
3976     #if VG_WORDSIZE != 8
3977           mach_msg_size_t size;
3978     #endif
3979           uint8_t deallocate;
3980           uint8_t copy;
3981           uint8_t pad1;
3982           uint8_t type;
3983     #if VG_WORDSIZE == 8
3984           mach_msg_size_t size;
3985     #endif
3986        } *desc = (void*)desc2;
3987     #pragma pack()
3988     
3989        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.out_of_line.address",    desc->address);
3990        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.out_of_line.size",       desc->size);
3991        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.out_of_line.deallocate", desc->deallocate);
3992        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.out_of_line.copy",       desc->copy);
3993        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.out_of_line.type",       desc->type);
3994     }
3995     
3996     static void pre_oolports_desc_read(ThreadId tid, 
3997                                        mach_msg_ool_ports_descriptor_t *desc2)
3998     {
3999     #pragma pack(4)
4000        struct {
4001           Addr address;
4002     #if VG_WORDSIZE != 8
4003           mach_msg_size_t size;
4004     #endif
4005           uint8_t deallocate;
4006           uint8_t copy;
4007           uint8_t disposition;
4008           uint8_t type;
4009     #if VG_WORDSIZE == 8
4010           mach_msg_size_t size;
4011     #endif
4012        } *desc = (void*)desc2;
4013     #pragma pack()
4014     
4015        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.ool_ports.address",     desc->address);
4016        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.ool_ports.size",        desc->size);
4017        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.ool_ports.deallocate",  desc->deallocate);
4018        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.ool_ports.copy",        desc->copy);
4019        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.ool_ports.disposition", desc->disposition);
4020        PRE_FIELD_READ("msg->desc.ool_ports.type",        desc->type);
4021     }
4022     
4023     
4024     // Returns the size of the descriptor area
4025     // (mach_msg_body_t + any mach_msg_descriptor_t)
4026     static size_t export_complex_message(ThreadId tid, mach_msg_header_t *mh)
4027     {
4028        mach_msg_body_t *body;
4029        mach_msg_size_t count, i;
4030        uint8_t *p;
4031        mach_msg_descriptor_t *desc;
4032        
4033        vg_assert(mh->msgh_bits & MACH_MSGH_BITS_COMPLEX);
4034        
4035        body = (mach_msg_body_t *)(mh+1);
4036        PRE_MEM_READ("msg->msgh_descriptor_count)", (Addr)body, sizeof(*body));
4037     
4038        count = body->msgh_descriptor_count;
4039        p = (uint8_t *)(body+1);
4040        
4041        for (i = 0; i < count; i++) {
4042           desc = (mach_msg_descriptor_t *)p;
4043           p += desc_size(desc);
4044           
4045           switch (desc->type.type) {
4046           case MACH_MSG_PORT_DESCRIPTOR:
4047              // single port; no memory map effects
4048              pre_port_desc_read(tid, &desc->port);
4049              break;
4050     
4051           case MACH_MSG_OOL_DESCRIPTOR:
4052           case MACH_MSG_OOL_VOLATILE_DESCRIPTOR:
4053              // out-of-line memory - unmap it if it's marked dealloc
4054              // GrP fixme need to remap if message fails?
4055              // GrP fixme how is VOLATILE different? do we care?
4056              // GrP fixme struct is different for lp64
4057              pre_ool_desc_read(tid, &desc->out_of_line);
4058     
4059              if (desc->out_of_line.deallocate  &&  desc->out_of_line.size > 0) {
4060                 vm_size_t size = desc->out_of_line.size;
4061                 Addr start = VG_PGROUNDDN((Addr)desc->out_of_line.address);
4062                 Addr end = VG_PGROUNDUP((Addr)desc->out_of_line.address + size);
4063                 PRINT("kill ool mem %p..%#lx; ", desc->out_of_line.address, 
4064                       (Addr)desc->out_of_line.address + size);
4065                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_munmap)(start, end - start);
4066              }
4067              break;
4068     
4069           case MACH_MSG_OOL_PORTS_DESCRIPTOR:
4070              // out-of-line array of ports - unmap it if it's marked dealloc
4071              // GrP fixme need to remap if message fails?
4072              // GrP fixme struct different for lp64
4073              pre_oolports_desc_read(tid, &desc->ool_ports);
4074     
4075              if (desc->ool_ports.deallocate  &&  desc->ool_ports.count > 0) {
4076                 vm_size_t size = desc->ool_ports.count * sizeof(mach_port_t);
4077                 Addr start = VG_PGROUNDDN((Addr)desc->ool_ports.address);
4078                 Addr end = VG_PGROUNDUP((Addr)desc->ool_ports.address + size);
4079                 PRINT("kill ool port array %p..%#lx; ", desc->ool_ports.address, 
4080                       (Addr)desc->ool_ports.address + size);
4081                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_munmap)(start, end - start);
4082              }
4083              break;
4084           default:
4085              VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN Mach descriptor type %u!\n", desc->type.type);
4086              break;
4087           }
4088        }
4089     
4090        return (size_t)((Addr)p - (Addr)body);
4091     }
4092     
4093     
4094     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
4095        mach_msg: host-related messages
4096        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
4097     
4098     
4099     POST(host_info)
4100     {
4101     #pragma pack(4)
4102        typedef struct {
4103           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4104           NDR_record_t NDR;
4105           kern_return_t RetCode;
4106           mach_msg_type_number_t host_info_outCnt;
4107           integer_t host_info_out[14];
4108        } Reply;
4109     #pragma pack()
4110     
4111        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4112     
4113        if (reply->RetCode) PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
4114     }
4115     
4116     PRE(host_info)
4117     {
4118     #pragma pack(4)
4119        typedef struct {
4120           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4121           NDR_record_t NDR;
4122           host_flavor_t flavor;
4123           mach_msg_type_number_t host_info_outCnt;
4124        } Request;
4125     #pragma pack()
4126     
4127        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4128     
4129        PRINT("host_info(mach_host_self(), flavor %d)", req->flavor);
4130     
4131        AFTER = POST_FN(host_info);
4132     }
4133     
4134     
4135     POST(host_page_size)
4136     {
4137     #pragma pack(4)
4138        typedef struct {
4139           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4140           NDR_record_t NDR;
4141           kern_return_t RetCode;
4142           vm_size_t out_page_size;
4143        } Reply;
4144     #pragma pack()
4145     
4146        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4147     
4148        if (!reply->RetCode) {
4149          PRINT("page size %llu", (ULong)reply->out_page_size);
4150        } else {
4151           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
4152        }
4153     }
4154     
4155     PRE(host_page_size)
4156     {
4157        PRINT("host_page_size(mach_host_self(), ...)");
4158         
4159        AFTER = POST_FN(host_page_size);
4160     }
4161     
4162     
4163     POST(host_get_io_master)
4164     {
4165     #pragma pack(4)
4166        typedef struct {
4167           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4168           /* start of the kernel processed data */
4169           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
4170           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t io_master;
4171           /* end of the kernel processed data */
4172        } Reply;
4173     #pragma pack()
4174     
4175        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4176     
4177        assign_port_name(reply->io_master.name, "io_master-%p");
4178        PRINT("%s", name_for_port(reply->io_master.name));
4179     }
4180     
4181     PRE(host_get_io_master)
4182     {
4183     #pragma pack(4)
4184        typedef struct {
4185           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4186        } Request;
4187     #pragma pack()
4188     
4189        // Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4190     
4191        PRINT("host_get_io_master(mach_host_self())");
4192     
4193        AFTER = POST_FN(host_get_io_master);
4194     }
4195     
4196     
4197     POST(host_get_clock_service)
4198     {
4199     #pragma pack(4)
4200        typedef struct {
4201           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4202           /* start of the kernel processed data */
4203           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
4204           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t clock_serv;
4205           /* end of the kernel processed data */
4206        } Reply;
4207     #pragma pack()
4208     
4209        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4210     
4211        assign_port_name(reply->clock_serv.name, "clock-%p");
4212        PRINT("%s", name_for_port(reply->clock_serv.name));
4213     }
4214     
4215     PRE(host_get_clock_service)
4216     {
4217     #pragma pack(4)
4218        typedef struct {
4219           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4220           NDR_record_t NDR;
4221           clock_id_t clock_id;
4222        } Request;
4223     #pragma pack()
4224     
4225        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4226     
4227        PRINT("host_get_clock_service(mach_host_self(), %d)", req->clock_id);
4228     
4229        AFTER = POST_FN(host_get_clock_service);
4230     }
4231     
4232     
4233     PRE(host_request_notification)
4234     {
4235     #pragma pack(4)
4236        typedef struct {
4237           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4238           /* start of the kernel processed data */
4239           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
4240           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t notify_port;
4241           /* end of the kernel processed data */
4242           NDR_record_t NDR;
4243           host_flavor_t notify_type;
4244        } Request;
4245     #pragma pack()
4246     
4247        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4248     
4249        if (MACH_REMOTE == mach_task_self()) { 
4250           if (req->notify_type == 0) {
4251              PRINT("host_request_notification(mach_host_self(), %s, %s)", 
4252                    "HOST_NOTIFY_CALENDAR_CHANGE", 
4253                    name_for_port(req->notify_port.name));
4254           } else {
4255              PRINT("host_request_notification(mach_host_self(), %d, %s)",
4256                    req->notify_type, 
4257                    name_for_port(req->notify_port.name));
4258           } 
4259        } else {
4260           PRINT("host_request_notification(%s, %d, %s)",
4261                 name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
4262                 req->notify_type, 
4263                 name_for_port(req->notify_port.name));
4264        }
4265     
4266         // GrP fixme only do this on success
4267        assign_port_name(req->notify_port.name, "host_notify-%p");
4268     }
4269     
4270     
4271     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
4272        mach_msg: messages to a task
4273        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
4274     
4275     
4276     PRE(mach_port_type)
4277     {
4278     #pragma pack(4)
4279        typedef struct {
4280           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4281           NDR_record_t NDR;
4282           mach_port_name_t name;
4283        } Request;
4284     #pragma pack()
4285     
4286        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4287     
4288        PRINT("mach_port_type(%s, %s, ...)", 
4289              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), name_for_port(req->name));
4290     
4291        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_type);
4292     }
4293     
4294     POST(mach_port_type)
4295     {
4296     }
4297     
4298     
4299     PRE(mach_port_extract_member)
4300     {
4301     #pragma pack(4)
4302        typedef struct {
4303           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4304           NDR_record_t NDR;
4305           mach_port_name_t name;
4306           mach_port_name_t pset;
4307        } Request;
4308     #pragma pack()
4309     
4310        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4311     
4312        PRINT("mach_port_extract_member(%s, 0x%x, 0x%x)", 
4313              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
4314              req->name, req->pset);
4315     
4316        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_extract_member);
4317     
4318        // GrP fixme port tracker?
4319     }
4320     
4321     POST(mach_port_extract_member)
4322     {
4323     #pragma pack(4)
4324        typedef struct {
4325           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4326           NDR_record_t NDR;
4327           kern_return_t RetCode;
4328        } Reply;
4329     #pragma pack()
4330     
4331        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4332     
4333        if (reply->RetCode) PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
4334     }
4335     
4336     
4337     PRE(mach_port_allocate)
4338     {
4339     #pragma pack(4)
4340        typedef struct {
4341           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4342           NDR_record_t NDR;
4343           mach_port_right_t right;
4344        } Request;
4345     #pragma pack()
4346     
4347        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4348     
4349        PRINT("mach_port_allocate(mach_task_self(), %d, ...)", req->right);
4350     
4351        MACH_ARG(mach_port_allocate.right) = req->right;
4352     
4353        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_allocate);
4354     }
4355     
4356     POST(mach_port_allocate)
4357     {
4358     #pragma pack(4)
4359        typedef struct {
4360           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4361           NDR_record_t NDR;
4362           kern_return_t RetCode;
4363           mach_port_name_t name;
4364        } Reply;
4365     #pragma pack()
4366     
4367        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4368     
4369        if (!reply->RetCode) {
4370           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
4371              // GrP fixme port tracking is too imprecise
4372              // vg_assert(!port_exists(reply->name));
4373              record_unnamed_port(tid, reply->name, MACH_ARG(mach_port_allocate.right));
4374              PRINT("got port 0x%x", reply->name);
4375           } else {
4376              VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN inserted port 0x%x into remote task\n", reply->name);
4377           }
4378        } else {
4379           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
4380        }
4381     }
4382     
4383     
4384     PRE(mach_port_deallocate)
4385     {
4386     #pragma pack(4)
4387        typedef struct {
4388           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4389           NDR_record_t NDR;
4390           mach_port_name_t name;
4391        } Request;
4392     #pragma pack()
4393     
4394        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4395     
4396        PRINT("mach_port_deallocate(%s, %s)", 
4397              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
4398              name_for_port(req->name));
4399     
4400        MACH_ARG(mach_port.port) = req->name;
4401     
4402        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_deallocate);
4403     
4404        // Must block to prevent race (other thread allocates and 
4405        // notifies after we deallocate but before we notify)
4406        *flags &= ~SfMayBlock;
4407     }
4408     
4409     POST(mach_port_deallocate)
4410     {
4411     #pragma pack(4)
4412        typedef struct {
4413           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4414           NDR_record_t NDR;
4415           kern_return_t RetCode;
4416        } Reply;
4417     #pragma pack()
4418        
4419        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4420     
4421        if (!reply->RetCode) {
4422           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
4423              // Must have cleared SfMayBlock in PRE to prevent race
4424              record_port_dealloc(MACH_ARG(mach_port.port));
4425           } else {
4426              VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN remote port dealloc\n");
4427           }
4428        } else {
4429           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
4430        }
4431     }
4432     
4433     
4434     PRE(mach_port_get_refs)
4435     {
4436     #pragma pack(4)
4437        typedef struct {
4438           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4439           NDR_record_t NDR;
4440           mach_port_name_t name;
4441           mach_port_right_t right;
4442        } Request;
4443     #pragma pack()
4444     
4445        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4446     
4447        PRINT("mach_port_get_refs(%s, %s, 0x%x)", 
4448              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
4449              name_for_port(req->name), req->right);
4450     
4451        MACH_ARG(mach_port_mod_refs.port) = req->name;
4452        MACH_ARG(mach_port_mod_refs.right) = req->right;
4453         
4454        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_get_refs);
4455     }
4456     
4457     POST(mach_port_get_refs)
4458     {
4459     #pragma pack(4)
4460        typedef struct {
4461           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4462           NDR_record_t NDR;
4463           kern_return_t RetCode;
4464           mach_port_urefs_t refs;
4465        } Reply;
4466     #pragma pack()
4467        
4468        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4469     
4470        if (!reply->RetCode) {
4471           PRINT("got refs=%d", reply->refs);
4472        } else {
4473           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
4474        }
4475     }
4476     
4477     
4478     PRE(mach_port_mod_refs)
4479     {
4480     #pragma pack(4)
4481        typedef struct {
4482           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4483           NDR_record_t NDR;
4484           mach_port_name_t name;
4485           mach_port_right_t right;
4486           mach_port_delta_t delta;
4487        } Request;
4488     #pragma pack()
4489     
4490        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4491     
4492        PRINT("mach_port_mod_refs(%s, %s, 0x%x, 0x%x)", 
4493              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
4494              name_for_port(req->name), req->right, req->delta);
4495     
4496        MACH_ARG(mach_port_mod_refs.port) = req->name;
4497        MACH_ARG(mach_port_mod_refs.right) = req->right;
4498        MACH_ARG(mach_port_mod_refs.delta) = req->delta;
4499         
4500        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_mod_refs);
4501     
4502        // Must block to prevent race (other thread allocates and 
4503        // notifies after we deallocate but before we notify)
4504        *flags &= ~SfMayBlock;
4505     }
4506     
4507     POST(mach_port_mod_refs)
4508     {
4509     #pragma pack(4)
4510        typedef struct {
4511           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4512           NDR_record_t NDR;
4513           kern_return_t RetCode;
4514        } Reply;
4515     #pragma pack()
4516        
4517        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4518     
4519        if (!reply->RetCode) {
4520           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
4521              // Must have cleared SfMayBlock in PRE to prevent race
4522              record_port_mod_refs(MACH_ARG(mach_port_mod_refs.port), 
4523                                   MACH_PORT_TYPE(MACH_ARG(mach_port_mod_refs.right)), 
4524                                   MACH_ARG(mach_port_mod_refs.delta));
4525           } else {
4526              VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN remote port mod refs\n");
4527           }
4528        } else {
4529           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
4530        }
4531     }
4532

4551     }

4565        } Reply;
4566     #pragma pack()
4567

4569

4571     }

4582         } Request;

4584

4586

4588               name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
4589               name_for_port(req->member), 
4590               name_for_port(req->after));
4591         /*
4592         MACH_ARG(mach_port_move_member.member) = req->member;
4593         MACH_ARG(mach_port_move_member.after) = req->after;
4594         */
4595         AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_move_member);
4596     }

4600     #pragma pack(4)

4602           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4603           NDR_record_t NDR;
4604           kern_return_t RetCode;
4605           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
4606        } Reply;
4607     #pragma pack()
4608     
4609        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4610     
4611        if (!reply->RetCode) {
4612           // fixme port set tracker?
4613        } else {
4614           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
4615        }
4616     }

4618     
4619     PRE(mach_port_destroy)
4620     {
4621     #pragma pack(4)
4622        typedef struct {
4623           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4624           NDR_record_t NDR;
4625           mach_port_name_t name;
4626        } Request;
4627     #pragma pack()
4628     
4629        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4630     
4631        PRINT("mach_port_destroy(%s, %s)", 
4632              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
4633              name_for_port(req->name));
4634     
4635        MACH_ARG(mach_port.port) = req->name;
4636     
4637        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_destroy);
4638     
4639        // Must block to prevent race (other thread allocates and 
4640        // notifies after we deallocate but before we notify)
4641        *flags &= ~SfMayBlock;
4642     }
4643     
4644     POST(mach_port_destroy)
4645     {
4646     #pragma pack(4)
4647        typedef struct {
4648           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4649           NDR_record_t NDR;
4650           kern_return_t RetCode;
4651        } Reply;
4652     #pragma pack()
4653        
4654        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4655     
4656        if (!reply->RetCode) {
4657           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
4658              // Must have cleared SfMayBlock in PRE to prevent race
4659              record_port_destroy(MACH_ARG(mach_port.port));
4660           } else {
4661              VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN remote port destroy\n");
4662           }
4663        } else {
4664           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
4665        }
4666     }
4667     
4668     
4669     PRE(mach_port_request_notification)
4670     {
4671     #pragma pack(4)
4672        typedef struct {
4673           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4674           /* start of the kernel processed data */
4675           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
4676           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t notify;
4677           /* end of the kernel processed data */
4678           NDR_record_t NDR;
4679           mach_port_name_t name;
4680           mach_msg_id_t msgid;
4681           mach_port_mscount_t sync;
4682        } Request;
4683     #pragma pack()
4684     
4685        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4686     
4687        PRINT("mach_port_request_notification(%s, %s, %d, %d, %d, %d, ...)", 
4688              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
4689              name_for_port(req->name), req->msgid, req->sync, 
4690              req->notify.name, req->notify.disposition);
4691     
4692        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_request_notification);
4693     }
4694     
4695     POST(mach_port_request_notification)
4696     {
4697        // GrP fixme port tracker? not sure
4698     }

4701     PRE(mach_port_insert_right)
4702     {
4703     #pragma pack(4)
4704        typedef struct {
4705           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4706           /* start of the kernel processed data */
4707           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
4708           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t poly;
4709           /* end of the kernel processed data */
4710           NDR_record_t NDR;
4711           mach_port_name_t name;
4712        } Request;
4713     #pragma pack()
4714     
4715        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4716     
4717        PRINT("mach_port_insert_right(%s, %s, %d, %d)", 
4718              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
4719              name_for_port(req->name), req->poly.name, req->poly.disposition);
4720     
4721        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_port_insert_right);
4722     
4723        if (MACH_REMOTE == mach_task_self()) {
4724           // GrP fixme import_complex_message handles everything?
4725           // what about export_complex_message for MOVE variants?
4726        } else {
4727           VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN mach_port_insert_right into remote task!\n");
4728           // GrP fixme also may remove rights from this task?
4729        }
4730     
4731        // GrP fixme port tracker?
4732     }
4733     
4734     POST(mach_port_insert_right)
4735     {
4736     }
4737

4845     
4846     PRE(task_get_special_port)
4847     {
4848     #pragma pack(4)
4849        typedef struct {
4850           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4851           NDR_record_t NDR;
4852           int which_port;
4853        } Request;
4854     #pragma pack()
4855        
4856        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4857        
4858        switch (req->which_port) {
4859        case TASK_KERNEL_PORT:
4860           PRINT("task_get_special_port(%s, TASK_KERNEL_PORT)", 
4861                 name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE));
4862           break;
4863        case TASK_HOST_PORT:
4864           PRINT("task_get_special_port(%s, TASK_HOST_PORT)", 
4865                 name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE));
4866           break;
4867        case TASK_BOOTSTRAP_PORT:
4868           PRINT("task_get_special_port(%s, TASK_BOOTSTRAP_PORT)", 
4869                 name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE));
4870           break;
4871        case TASK_WIRED_LEDGER_PORT:
4872           PRINT("task_get_special_port(%s, TASK_WIRED_LEDGER_PORT)", 
4873                 name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE));
4874           break;
4875        case TASK_PAGED_LEDGER_PORT:
4876           PRINT("task_get_special_port(%s, TASK_PAGED_LEDGER_PORT)", 
4877                 name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE));
4878           break;
4879        default:
4880           PRINT("task_get_special_port(%s, %d)", 
4881                 name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), req->which_port);
4882           break;
4883        }
4884        
4885        MACH_ARG(task_get_special_port.which_port) = req->which_port;
4886        
4887        AFTER = POST_FN(task_get_special_port);
4888     }
4889     
4890     POST(task_get_special_port)
4891     {
4892     #pragma pack(4)
4893        typedef struct {
4894           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4895           /* start of the kernel processed data */
4896           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
4897           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t special_port;
4898           /* end of the kernel processed data */
4899        } Reply;
4900     #pragma pack()
4901        
4902        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4903     
4904        PRINT("got port %#x ", reply->special_port.name);
4905     
4906        switch (MACH_ARG(task_get_special_port.which_port)) {
4907        case TASK_BOOTSTRAP_PORT:
4908           vg_bootstrap_port = reply->special_port.name;
4909           assign_port_name(reply->special_port.name, "bootstrap");
4910           break;
4911        case TASK_KERNEL_PORT:
4912           assign_port_name(reply->special_port.name, "kernel");
4913           break;
4914        case TASK_HOST_PORT:
4915           assign_port_name(reply->special_port.name, "host");
4916           break;
4917        case TASK_WIRED_LEDGER_PORT:
4918           assign_port_name(reply->special_port.name, "wired-ledger");
4919           break;
4920        case TASK_PAGED_LEDGER_PORT:
4921           assign_port_name(reply->special_port.name, "paged-ledger");
4922           break;
4923        default:
4924           assign_port_name(reply->special_port.name, "special-%p");
4925           break;
4926        }
4927     
4928        PRINT("%s", name_for_port(reply->special_port.name));
4929     }
4930     
4931     
4932     PRE(semaphore_create)
4933     {
4934     #pragma pack(4)
4935        typedef struct {
4936           mach_msg_header_t Head;

4946              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), req->policy, req->value);
4947     
4948        AFTER = POST_FN(semaphore_create);
4949     }
4950     
4951     POST(semaphore_create)
4952     {
4953     #pragma pack(4)
4954        typedef struct {
4955           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4956           /* start of the kernel processed data */
4957           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
4958           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t semaphore;
4959           /* end of the kernel processed data */
4960           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
4961        } Reply;
4962     #pragma pack()
4963     
4964        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
4965     
4966        assign_port_name(reply->semaphore.name, "semaphore-%p");
4967        PRINT("%s", name_for_port(reply->semaphore.name));
4968     }
4969

4971     PRE(semaphore_destroy)
4972     {
4973     #pragma pack(4)
4974        typedef struct {
4975           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4976           /* start of the kernel processed data */
4977           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
4978           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t semaphore;
4979           /* end of the kernel processed data */
4980           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
4981        } Request;
4982     #pragma pack()
4983     
4984        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
4985     
4986        PRINT("semaphore_destroy(%s, %s)", 
4987              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), name_for_port(req->semaphore.name));
4988     
4989        record_port_destroy(req->semaphore.name);
4990     
4991        AFTER = POST_FN(semaphore_destroy);
4992     }
4993     
4994     POST(semaphore_destroy)
4995     {
4996     #pragma pack(4)
4997        typedef struct {
4998           mach_msg_header_t Head;
4999           NDR_record_t NDR;
5000           kern_return_t RetCode;
5001           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5002        } Reply;
5003     #pragma pack()
5004     
5005        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;        
5006        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5007        } else {
5008           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5009        }
5010     }

5046     PRE(task_threads)
5047     {
5048     #pragma pack(4)
5049        typedef struct {
5050           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5051        } Request;
5052     #pragma pack()
5053

5057     
5058        AFTER = POST_FN(task_threads);
5059     }
5060     
5061     POST(task_threads)
5062     {
5063     #pragma pack(4)
5064        typedef struct {
5065           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5066           /* start of the kernel processed data */
5067           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
5068           mach_msg_ool_ports_descriptor_t act_list;
5069           /* end of the kernel processed data */
5070           NDR_record_t NDR;
5071           mach_msg_type_number_t act_listCnt;
5072           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5073        } Reply;
5074     #pragma pack()
5075     
5076        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5077     
5078        if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5079           assign_port_names(&reply->act_list, "thread-%p");
5080        } else {
5081           assign_port_names(&reply->act_list, "remote-thread-%p");
5082        }
5083     }
5084     
5085     
5086     PRE(task_suspend)
5087     {
5088        PRINT("task_suspend(%s)", name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE));
5089     
5090        if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5091           // GrP fixme self-suspend
5092           vg_assert(0);
5093        } else {
5094           // suspend other - no problem
5095        }
5096     
5097        AFTER = POST_FN(task_suspend);
5098     }
5099     
5100     POST(task_suspend)
5101     {
5102     }
5103     
5104

5106     {

5108     
5109        if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5110           // GrP fixme self-resume
5111           vg_assert(0);
5112        } else {
5113           // resume other - no problem
5114        }
5115     
5116        AFTER = POST_FN(task_resume);
5117     }
5118     
5119     POST(task_resume)
5120     {
5121     }

5123     
5124     PRE(vm_allocate)
5125     {
5126     #pragma pack(4)
5127        typedef struct {
5128           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5129           NDR_record_t NDR;
5130           vm_address_t address;
5131           vm_size_t size;
5132           int flags;
5133        } Request;
5134     #pragma pack()
5135     
5136        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5137     
5138        PRINT("vm_allocate (%s, at %#llx, size %lld, flags %#x)", 
5139              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5140              (ULong)req->address, (ULong)req->size, req->flags);
5141     
5142        MACH_ARG(vm_allocate.size) = req->size;
5143        MACH_ARG(vm_allocate.flags) = req->flags;
5144     
5145        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_allocate);
5146     }
5147     
5148     POST(vm_allocate)
5149     {
5150     #pragma pack(4)
5151        typedef struct {
5152           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5153           NDR_record_t NDR;
5154           kern_return_t RetCode;
5155           vm_address_t address;
5156           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5157        } Reply;
5158     #pragma pack()
5159        
5160        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5161        
5162        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5163           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5164             PRINT("allocated at %#llx", (ULong)reply->address);
5165              // requesting 0 bytes returns address 0 with no error
5166              if (MACH_ARG(vm_allocate.size)) {
5167                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mmap)(
5168                       reply->address, MACH_ARG(vm_allocate.size), 
5169                       VKI_PROT_READ|VKI_PROT_WRITE, VKI_MAP_ANON, -1, 0);
5170              }
5171           } else {
5172              PRINT("allocated at %#llx in remote task %s",
5173                    (ULong)reply->address, 
5174                    name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE));
5175           }
5176        } else {
5177           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5178        }
5179     }
5180     
5181     
5182     PRE(vm_deallocate)
5183     {
5184     #pragma pack(4)
5185        typedef struct {
5186           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5187           NDR_record_t NDR;
5188           vm_address_t address;
5189           vm_size_t size;
5190        } Request;
5191     #pragma pack()
5192        
5193        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5194        
5195        PRINT("vm_deallocate(%s, at %#llx, size %lld)", 
5196              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5197              (ULong)req->address, (ULong)req->size);
5198        
5199        MACH_ARG(vm_deallocate.address) = req->address;
5200        MACH_ARG(vm_deallocate.size) = req->size;
5201        
5202        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_deallocate);
5203     
5204        // Must block to prevent race (other thread allocates and 
5205        // notifies after we deallocate but before we notify)
5206        *flags &= ~SfMayBlock;
5207     }
5208     
5209     POST(vm_deallocate)
5210     {
5211     #pragma pack(4)
5212        typedef struct {
5213           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5214           NDR_record_t NDR;
5215           kern_return_t RetCode;
5216           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5217        } Reply;
5218     #pragma pack()
5219        
5220        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5221        
5222        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5223           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5224              if (MACH_ARG(vm_deallocate.size)) {
5225                 Addr start = VG_PGROUNDDN(MACH_ARG(vm_deallocate.address));
5226                 Addr end = VG_PGROUNDUP(MACH_ARG(vm_deallocate.address) + 
5227                                         MACH_ARG(vm_deallocate.size));
5228                 // Must have cleared SfMayBlock in PRE to prevent race
5229                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_munmap)(start, end - start);
5230              }
5231           }
5232        } else {
5233           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5234        }
5235     }
5236        
5237     
5238     PRE(vm_protect)
5239     {
5240     #pragma pack(4)
5241        typedef struct {
5242           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5243           NDR_record_t NDR;
5244           vm_address_t address;
5245           vm_size_t size;
5246           boolean_t set_maximum;
5247           vm_prot_t new_protection;
5248        } Request;
5249     #pragma pack()
5250        
5251        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5252        
5253        PRINT("vm_protect(%s, at %#llx, size %lld, set_max %d, prot %d)", 
5254              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE),
5255              (ULong)req->address, (ULong)req->size, 
5256              req->set_maximum, req->new_protection);
5257        
5258        MACH_ARG(vm_protect.address) = req->address;
5259        MACH_ARG(vm_protect.size) = req->size;
5260        MACH_ARG(vm_protect.set_maximum) = req->set_maximum;
5261        MACH_ARG(vm_protect.new_protection) = req->new_protection;
5262        
5263        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_protect);
5264     }
5265     
5266     POST(vm_protect)
5267     {
5268     #pragma pack(4)
5269        typedef struct {
5270           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5271           NDR_record_t NDR;
5272           kern_return_t RetCode;
5273           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5274        } Reply;
5275     #pragma pack()
5276        
5277        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5278        
5279        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5280           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5281              Addr start = VG_PGROUNDDN(MACH_ARG(vm_protect.address));
5282              Addr end = VG_PGROUNDUP(MACH_ARG(vm_protect.address) + 
5283                                      MACH_ARG(vm_protect.size));
5284              UInt prot = MACH_ARG(vm_protect.new_protection);
5285              if (MACH_ARG(vm_protect.set_maximum)) {
5286                  // GrP fixme mprotect max
5287                  VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN vm_protect set maximum");
5288                 //VG_(mprotect_max_range)(start, end-start, prot);
5289              } else {
5290                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mprotect)(start, end-start, prot);
5291              }
5292           }
5293        } else {
5294           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5295        }
5296     }
5297     
5298     
5299     PRE(vm_inherit)
5300     {
5301     #pragma pack(4)
5302        typedef struct {
5303           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5304           NDR_record_t NDR;
5305           vm_address_t address;
5306           vm_size_t size;
5307           vm_inherit_t new_inheritance;
5308        } Request;
5309     #pragma pack()
5310        
5311        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5312        
5313        PRINT("vm_inherit(%s, at %#llx, size %lld, value %d)", 
5314              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5315              (ULong)req->address, (ULong)req->size, 
5316              req->new_inheritance);
5317        
5318        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_inherit);
5319     }

5321     POST(vm_inherit)
5322     {
5323     #pragma pack(4)
5324        typedef struct {
5325           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5326           NDR_record_t NDR;
5327           kern_return_t RetCode;
5328           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5329        } Reply;
5330     #pragma pack()
5331        
5332        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5333        
5334        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5335           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5336              // GrP fixme do something?
5337           }
5338        } else {
5339           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5340        }
5341     }
