5343     
5344     PRE(vm_read)
5345     {
5346     #pragma pack(4)
5347        typedef struct {
5348           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5349           NDR_record_t NDR;
5350           vm_address_t address;
5351           vm_size_t size;
5352        } Request;
5353     #pragma pack()
5354     
5355        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5356     
5357        PRINT("vm_read(from %s at %#llx size %llu)", 
5358              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE),
5359              (ULong)req->address, (ULong)req->size);
5360        
5361        MACH_ARG(vm_read.addr) = req->address;
5362        MACH_ARG(vm_read.size) = req->size;
5363     
5364        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_read);
5365     }
5366     
5367     POST(vm_read)
5368     {
5369     #pragma pack(4)
5370        typedef struct {
5371           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5372           /* start of the kernel processed data */
5373           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
5374           mach_msg_ool_descriptor_t data;
5375           /* end of the kernel processed data */
5376           NDR_record_t NDR;
5377           mach_msg_type_number_t dataCnt;
5378        } Reply;
5379     #pragma pack()
5380     
5381        // Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5382     
5383        if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5384           // vm_read from self
5385           // GrP fixme copy initialized state
5386        }
5387     }
5388     
5389     
5390     
5391     PRE(mach_vm_read)
5392     {
5393     #pragma pack(4)
5394        typedef struct {
5395           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5396           NDR_record_t NDR;
5397           mach_vm_address_t address;
5398           mach_vm_size_t size;
5399        } Request;
5400     #pragma pack()
5401     
5402        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5403     
5404        PRINT("mach_vm_read(from %s at 0x%llx size %llu)", 
5405              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), req->address, req->size);
5406        
5407        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_read.addr) = req->address;
5408        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_read.size) = req->size;
5409     
5410        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_vm_read);
5411     }
5412     
5413     POST(mach_vm_read)
5414     {
5415     #pragma pack(4)
5416        typedef struct {
5417           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5418           /* start of the kernel processed data */
5419           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
5420           mach_msg_ool_descriptor_t data;
5421           /* end of the kernel processed data */
5422           NDR_record_t NDR;
5423           mach_msg_type_number_t dataCnt;
5424        } Reply;
5425     #pragma pack()
5426     
5427        // Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5428     
5429        if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5430           // vm_read from self
5431           // GrP fixme copy initialized state
5432        }
5433     }
5434     
5435     
5436     PRE(vm_read_overwrite)
5437     {
5438     #pragma pack(4)
5439        typedef struct {
5440           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5441           NDR_record_t NDR;
5442           vm_address_t address;
5443           vm_size_t size;
5444           vm_address_t data;
5445        } Request;
5446     #pragma pack()
5447     
5448        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5449     
5450        PRINT("vm_read_overwrite(from %s at %#llx size %llu to %#llx)", 
5451              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE),
5452              (ULong)req->address, (ULong)req->size, (ULong)req->data);
5453        
5454        MACH_ARG(vm_read_overwrite.addr) = req->address;
5455        MACH_ARG(vm_read_overwrite.size) = req->size;
5456        MACH_ARG(vm_read_overwrite.data) = req->data;
5457     
5458        PRE_MEM_WRITE("vm_read_overwrite(data)", req->data, req->size);
5459     
5460        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_read_overwrite);
5461     }
5462     
5463     POST(vm_read_overwrite)
5464     {
5465     #pragma pack(4)
5466        typedef struct {
5467           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5468           NDR_record_t NDR;
5469           kern_return_t RetCode;
5470           vm_size_t outsize;
5471        } Reply;
5472     #pragma pack()
5473     
5474        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5475     
5476        if (reply->RetCode) {
5477            PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5478        } else {
5479           PRINT("read %llu bytes", (unsigned long long)reply->outsize);
5480           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5481              // vm_read_overwrite from self
5482              // GrP fixme copy initialized state
5483              POST_MEM_WRITE(MACH_ARG(vm_read_overwrite.data), reply->outsize);
5484           } else {
5485              // vm_read_overwrite from remote
5486              POST_MEM_WRITE(MACH_ARG(vm_read_overwrite.data), reply->outsize);
5487           }
5488        }
5489     }
5490     
5491     
5492     PRE(vm_copy)
5493     {
5494     #pragma pack(4)
5495        typedef struct {
5496           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5497           NDR_record_t NDR;
5498           vm_address_t source_address;
5499           vm_size_t size;
5500           vm_address_t dest_address;
5501        } Request;
5502     #pragma pack()
5503        
5504        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5505        
5506        PRINT("vm_copy(%s, %#llx, %lld, %#llx)", 
5507              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5508              (ULong)req->source_address,
5509              (ULong)req->size, (ULong)req->dest_address);
5510     
5511        MACH_ARG(vm_copy.src) = req->source_address;
5512        MACH_ARG(vm_copy.dst) = req->dest_address;
5513        MACH_ARG(vm_copy.size) = req->size;
5514        
5515        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_copy);
5516     }
5517     
5518     POST(vm_copy)
5519     {
5520     #pragma pack(4)
5521        typedef struct {
5522           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5523           NDR_record_t NDR;
5524           kern_return_t RetCode;
5525           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5526        } Reply;
5527     #pragma pack()
5528        
5529        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5530        
5531        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5532           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5533              // GrP fixme set dst's initialization equal to src's
5534              // and wipe any symbols or translations in dst
5535           }
5536        } else {
5537           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5538        }
5539     }
5540     
5541     
5542     PRE(vm_map)
5543     {
5544     #pragma pack(4)
5545        typedef struct {
5546           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5547           /* start of the kernel processed data */
5548           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
5549           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t object;
5550           /* end of the kernel processed data */
5551           NDR_record_t NDR;
5552           vm_address_t address;
5553           vm_size_t size;
5554           vm_address_t mask;
5555           int flags;
5556           vm_offset_t offset;
5557           boolean_t copy;
5558           vm_prot_t cur_protection;
5559           vm_prot_t max_protection;
5560           vm_inherit_t inheritance;
5561        } Request;
5562     #pragma pack()
5563     
5564        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5565     
5566        // GrP fixme check these
5567        PRINT("vm_map(in %s, at %#llx, size %lld, from %s ...)", 
5568              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5569              (ULong)req->address, (ULong)req->size, 
5570              name_for_port(req->object.name));
5571     
5572        MACH_ARG(vm_map.size) = req->size;
5573        MACH_ARG(vm_map.copy) = req->copy;
5574        MACH_ARG(vm_map.protection) = (req->cur_protection & req->max_protection);
5575     
5576        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_map);
5577     }
5578     
5579     POST(vm_map)
5580     {
5581     #pragma pack(4)
5582        typedef struct {
5583           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5584           NDR_record_t NDR;
5585           kern_return_t RetCode;
5586           vm_address_t address;
5587           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5588        } Reply;
5589     #pragma pack()
5590     
5591        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5592     
5593        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5594           // GrP fixme check src and dest tasks
5595          PRINT("mapped at %#llx", (ULong)reply->address);
5596           // GrP fixme max prot
5597           ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mmap)(
5598                 reply->address, VG_PGROUNDUP(MACH_ARG(vm_map.size)), 
5599                 MACH_ARG(vm_map.protection), VKI_MAP_SHARED, -1, 0);
5600           // GrP fixme VKI_MAP_PRIVATE if !copy?
5601        } else {
5602           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5603        }
5604     }
5605     
5606     
5607     PRE(vm_remap)
5608     {
5609     #pragma pack(4)
5610        typedef struct {
5611           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5612           /* start of the kernel processed data */
5613           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
5614           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t src_task;
5615           /* end of the kernel processed data */
5616           NDR_record_t NDR;
5617           vm_address_t target_address;
5618           vm_size_t size;
5619           vm_address_t mask;
5620           boolean_t anywhere;
5621           vm_address_t src_address;
5622           boolean_t copy;
5623           vm_inherit_t inheritance;
5624        } Request;
5625     #pragma pack()
5626     
5627        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5628     
5629        // GrP fixme check src and dest tasks
5630     
5631        if (VG_(clo_trace_syscalls)) {
5632           mach_port_name_t source_task = req->src_task.name;
5633           if (source_task == mach_task_self()) {
5634              PRINT("vm_remap(mach_task_self(), "
5635                    "to %#llx size %lld, from mach_task_self() at %#llx, ...)",
5636                    (ULong)req->target_address,
5637                    (ULong)req->size, (ULong)req->src_address);
5638           } else {
5639              PRINT("vm_remap(mach_task_self(), "
5640                    "to %#llx size %lld, from task %u at %#llx, ...)",
5641                    (ULong)req->target_address, (ULong)req->size, 
5642                    source_task, (ULong)req->src_address);
5643           }
5644        }
5645     
5646        // arg1 is task
5647        // vt->syscall_arg2 = req->target_address;
5648        MACH_ARG(vm_remap.size) = req->size;
5649        // vt->syscall_arg4 = req->copy;
5650     
5651        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_remap);
5652     }
5653     
5654     POST(vm_remap)
5655     {
5656     #pragma pack(4)
5657        typedef struct {
5658           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5659           NDR_record_t NDR;
5660           kern_return_t RetCode;
5661           vm_address_t target_address;
5662           vm_prot_t cur_protection;
5663           vm_prot_t max_protection;
5664           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5665        } Reply;
5666     #pragma pack()
5667     
5668        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5669     
5670        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5671           // GrP fixme check src and dest tasks
5672           UInt prot = reply->cur_protection & reply->max_protection;
5673           // GrP fixme max prot
5674           PRINT("mapped at %#llx", (ULong)reply->target_address);
5675           ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mmap)(
5676                 reply->target_address, VG_PGROUNDUP(MACH_ARG(vm_remap.size)), 
5677                 prot, VKI_MAP_SHARED, -1, 0);
5678           // GrP fixme VKI_MAP_FIXED if !copy?
5679           // GrP fixme copy initialized bits from source to dest if source_task is also mach_task_self
5680        } else {
5681           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5682        }
5683     }
5684     
5685     
5686     PRE(mach_make_memory_entry_64)
5687     {
5688     #pragma pack(4)
5689        typedef struct {
5690           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5691           /* start of the kernel processed data */
5692           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
5693           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t parent_entry;
5694           /* end of the kernel processed data */
5695           NDR_record_t NDR;
5696           memory_object_size_t size;
5697           memory_object_offset_t offset;
5698           vm_prot_t permission;
5699        } Request;
5700     #pragma pack()
5701     
5702        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5703     
5704        PRINT("mach_make_memory_entry_64(%s, %llu, %llu, %d, ..., %u)", 
5705              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5706              req->size, req->offset, req->permission, req->parent_entry.type);
5707     
5708        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_make_memory_entry_64);
5709     }
5710     
5711     POST(mach_make_memory_entry_64)
5712     {
5713     #pragma pack(4)
5714        typedef struct {
5715           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5716           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
5717           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t object;
5718           NDR_record_t NDR;
5719           memory_object_size_t size;
5720        } Reply;
5721     #pragma pack()
5722     
5723        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5724     
5725        if (reply->Head.msgh_bits & MACH_MSGH_BITS_COMPLEX) {
5726           assign_port_name(reply->object.name, "memory-%p");
5727           PRINT("%s", name_for_port(reply->object.name));
5728        }
5729     }
5730     
5731     
5732     PRE(vm_purgable_control)
5733     {
5734     #pragma pack(4)
5735        typedef struct {
5736           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5737           NDR_record_t NDR;
5738           vm_address_t address;
5739           vm_purgable_t control;
5740           int state;
5741        } Request;
5742     #pragma pack()
5743     
5744        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5745     
5746        PRINT("vm_purgable_control(%s, %#llx, %d, %d)", 
5747              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5748              (ULong)req->address, req->control, req->state);
5749     
5750        // GrP fixme verify address?
5751     
5752        AFTER = POST_FN(vm_purgable_control);
5753     }
5754     
5755     POST(vm_purgable_control)
5756     {
5757     #pragma pack(4)
5758        typedef struct {
5759           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5760           NDR_record_t NDR;
5761           kern_return_t RetCode;
5762           int state;
5763        } Reply;
5764     #pragma pack()
5765     
5766        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5767     
5768        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5769        } else {
5770           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5771        }
5772     }
5773     
5774     
5775     PRE(mach_vm_purgable_control)
5776     {
5777     #pragma pack(4)
5778        typedef struct {
5779           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5780           NDR_record_t NDR;
5781           mach_vm_address_t address;
5782           vm_purgable_t control;
5783           int state;
5784        } Request;
5785     #pragma pack()
5786     
5787        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5788     
5789        PRINT("mach_vm_purgable_control(%s, 0x%llx, %d, %d)", 
5790              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5791              (unsigned long long)req->address, req->control, req->state);
5792     
5793        // GrP fixme verify address?
5794     
5795        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_vm_purgable_control);
5796     }
5797     
5798     POST(mach_vm_purgable_control)
5799     {
5800     #pragma pack(4)
5801        typedef struct {
5802           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5803           NDR_record_t NDR;
5804           kern_return_t RetCode;
5805           int state;
5806        } Reply;
5807     #pragma pack()
5808     
5809        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5810     
5811        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5812        } else {
5813           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5814        }
5815     }
5816     
5817     
5818     PRE(mach_vm_allocate)
5819     {
5820     #pragma pack(4)
5821        typedef struct {
5822           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5823           NDR_record_t NDR;
5824           mach_vm_address_t address;
5825           mach_vm_size_t size;
5826           int flags;
5827        } Request;
5828     #pragma pack()
5829     
5830        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5831     
5832        PRINT("mach_vm_allocate (%s, at 0x%llx, size %lld, flags 0x%x)", 
5833              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5834              req->address, req->size, req->flags);
5835     
5836        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_allocate.size) = req->size;
5837        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_allocate.flags) = req->flags;
5838     
5839        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_vm_allocate);
5840     }
5841     
5842     POST(mach_vm_allocate)
5843     {
5844     #pragma pack(4)
5845        typedef struct {
5846           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5847           NDR_record_t NDR;
5848           kern_return_t RetCode;
5849           mach_vm_address_t address;
5850           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5851        } Reply;
5852     #pragma pack()
5853        
5854        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5855        
5856        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5857           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5858              PRINT("allocated at 0x%llx", reply->address);
5859              // requesting 0 bytes returns address 0 with no error
5860              if (MACH_ARG(mach_vm_allocate.size)) {
5861                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mmap)(
5862                       reply->address, MACH_ARG(mach_vm_allocate.size), 
5863                       VKI_PROT_READ|VKI_PROT_WRITE, VKI_MAP_ANON, -1, 0);
5864              }
5865           } else {
5866              PRINT("allocated at 0x%llx in remote task %s", reply->address, 
5867                    name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE));
5868           }
5869        } else {
5870           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5871        }
5872     }
5873     
5874     
5875     PRE(mach_vm_deallocate)
5876     {
5877     #pragma pack(4)
5878        typedef struct {
5879           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5880           NDR_record_t NDR;
5881           mach_vm_address_t address;
5882           mach_vm_size_t size;
5883        } Request;
5884     #pragma pack()
5885        
5886        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5887        
5888        PRINT("mach_vm_deallocate(%s, at 0x%llx, size %lld)", 
5889              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
5890              req->address, req->size);
5891        
5892        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_deallocate.address) = req->address;
5893        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_deallocate.size) = req->size;
5894        
5895        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_vm_deallocate);
5896     
5897        // Must block to prevent race (other thread allocates and 
5898        // notifies after we deallocate but before we notify)
5899        *flags &= ~SfMayBlock;
5900     }
5901     
5902     POST(mach_vm_deallocate)
5903     {
5904     #pragma pack(4)
5905        typedef struct {
5906           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5907           NDR_record_t NDR;
5908           kern_return_t RetCode;
5909           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5910        } Reply;
5911     #pragma pack()
5912        
5913        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5914        
5915        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5916           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5917              if (MACH_ARG(mach_vm_deallocate.size)) {
5918                 Addr start = VG_PGROUNDDN(MACH_ARG(mach_vm_deallocate.address));
5919                 Addr end = VG_PGROUNDUP(MACH_ARG(mach_vm_deallocate.address) + 
5920                                         MACH_ARG(mach_vm_deallocate.size));
5921                 // Must have cleared SfMayBlock in PRE to prevent race
5922                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_munmap)(start, end - start);
5923              }
5924           }
5925        } else {
5926           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5927        }
5928     }
5929        
5930     
5931     PRE(mach_vm_protect)
5932     {
5933     #pragma pack(4)
5934        typedef struct {
5935           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5936           NDR_record_t NDR;
5937           mach_vm_address_t address;
5938           mach_vm_size_t size;
5939           boolean_t set_maximum;
5940           vm_prot_t new_protection;
5941        } Request;
5942     #pragma pack()
5943        
5944        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
5945        
5946        PRINT("mach_vm_protect(%s, at 0x%llx, size %lld, set_max %d, prot %d)", 
5947              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), req->address, req->size, 
5948              req->set_maximum, req->new_protection);
5949        
5950        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_protect.address) = req->address;
5951        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_protect.size) = req->size;
5952        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_protect.set_maximum) = req->set_maximum;
5953        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_protect.new_protection) = req->new_protection;
5954        
5955        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_vm_protect);
5956     }
5957     
5958     POST(mach_vm_protect)
5959     {
5960     #pragma pack(4)
5961        typedef struct {
5962           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5963           NDR_record_t NDR;
5964           kern_return_t RetCode;
5965           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
5966        } Reply;
5967     #pragma pack()
5968        
5969        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
5970        
5971        if (!reply->RetCode) {
5972           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
5973              Addr start = VG_PGROUNDDN(MACH_ARG(mach_vm_protect.address));
5974              Addr end = VG_PGROUNDUP(MACH_ARG(mach_vm_protect.address) + 
5975                                      MACH_ARG(mach_vm_protect.size));
5976              UInt prot = MACH_ARG(mach_vm_protect.new_protection);
5977              if (MACH_ARG(mach_vm_protect.set_maximum)) {
5978                 // DDD: #warning GrP fixme mprotect max
5979                 //VG_(mprotect_max_range)(start, end-start, prot);
5980              } else {
5981                 ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mprotect)(start, end-start, prot);
5982              }
5983           }
5984        } else {
5985           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
5986        }
5987     }
5988     
5989     
5990     PRE(mach_vm_inherit)
5991     {
5992     #pragma pack(4)
5993        typedef struct {
5994           mach_msg_header_t Head;
5995           NDR_record_t NDR;
5996           mach_vm_address_t address;
5997           mach_vm_size_t size;
5998           vm_inherit_t new_inheritance;
5999        } Request;
6000     #pragma pack()
6001     
6002        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
6003        
6004        PRINT("mach_vm_inherit(to %s, at 0x%llx, size %llu, value %u)", 
6005              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
6006              req->address, req->size, req->new_inheritance);
6007     
6008        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_vm_inherit);
6009     }
6010     
6011     POST(mach_vm_inherit)
6012     {
6013     #pragma pack(4)
6014        typedef struct {
6015           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6016           NDR_record_t NDR;
6017           kern_return_t RetCode;
6018           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
6019        } Reply;
6020     #pragma pack()
6021        
6022        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
6023        
6024        if (!reply->RetCode) {
6025           // no V-visible side effects
6026           // GrP fixme except maybe fork/exec
6027        } else {
6028           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
6029        }
6030     }
6031

6033     PRE(mach_vm_copy)
6034     {
6035     #pragma pack(4)
6036        typedef struct {
6037           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6038           NDR_record_t NDR;
6039           mach_vm_address_t source_address;
6040           mach_vm_size_t size;
6041           mach_vm_address_t dest_address;
6042        } Request;
6043     #pragma pack()

6048              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
6049              req->source_address, req->size, req->dest_address);
6050        
6051        // arg1 is task
6052        // vt->syscall_arg2 = req->source_address;
6053        // vt->syscall_arg3 = req->size;
6054        // vt->syscall_arg4 = req->dest_address;
6055        
6056        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_vm_copy);
6057     }

6060     {
6061     #pragma pack(4)
6062        typedef struct {
6063           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6064           NDR_record_t NDR;
6065           kern_return_t RetCode;
6066           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
6067        } Reply;
6068     #pragma pack()
6069        
6070        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
6071        
6072        if (!reply->RetCode) {
6073           if (MACH_REMOTE == vg_task_port) {
6074              // GrP fixme set dest's initialization equal to src's
6075              // BUT vm_copy allocates no memory
6076           }
6077        } else {
6078           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
6079        }
6080     }
6081     
6082     
6083     PRE(mach_vm_map)
6084     {
6085     #pragma pack(4)
6086        typedef struct {
6087           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6088           /* start of the kernel processed data */
6089           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
6090           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t object;
6091           /* end of the kernel processed data */
6092           NDR_record_t NDR;
6093           mach_vm_address_t address;
6094           mach_vm_size_t size;
6095           mach_vm_address_t mask;
6096           int flags;
6097           memory_object_offset_t offset;
6098           boolean_t copy;
6099           vm_prot_t cur_protection;
6100           vm_prot_t max_protection;
6101           vm_inherit_t inheritance;
6102        } Request;
6103     #pragma pack()
6104     
6105        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
6106     
6107        // GrP fixme check these
6108        PRINT("mach_vm_map(in %s, at 0x%llx, size %llu, from %s ...)", 
6109              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
6110              req->address, req->size, 
6111              name_for_port(req->object.name));
6112     
6113        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_map.size) = req->size;
6114        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_map.copy) = req->copy;
6115        MACH_ARG(mach_vm_map.protection) = 
6116           (req->cur_protection & req->max_protection);
6117     
6118        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_vm_map);
6119     }
6120     
6121     POST(mach_vm_map)
6122     {
6123     #pragma pack(4)
6124        typedef struct {
6125           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6126           NDR_record_t NDR;
6127           kern_return_t RetCode;
6128           mach_vm_address_t address;
6129           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
6130        } Reply;
6131     #pragma pack()
6132     
6133        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
6134     
6135        if (!reply->RetCode) {
6136           // GrP fixme check src and dest tasks
6137           PRINT("mapped at 0x%llx", reply->address);
6138           // GrP fixme max prot
6139           ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_mmap)(
6140                 reply->address, VG_PGROUNDUP(MACH_ARG(mach_vm_map.size)), 
6141                 MACH_ARG(mach_vm_map.protection), VKI_MAP_SHARED, -1, 0);
6142           // GrP fixme VKI_MAP_PRIVATE if !copy?
6143        } else {
6144           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
6145        }
6146     }
6147     
6148     
6149     PRE(mach_vm_region_recurse)
6150     {
6151     #pragma pack(4)
6152        typedef struct {
6153           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6154           NDR_record_t NDR;
6155           mach_vm_address_t address;
6156           natural_t nesting_depth;
6157           mach_msg_type_number_t infoCnt;
6158        } Request;
6159     #pragma pack()
6160     
6161        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
6162     
6163        PRINT("mach_vm_region_recurse(in %s, at 0x%llx, depth %u, count %u)", 
6164              name_for_port(MACH_REMOTE), 
6165              req->address, req->nesting_depth, req->infoCnt);
6166     
6167        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_vm_region_recurse);
6168     }
6169     
6170     POST(mach_vm_region_recurse)
6171     {
6172     #pragma pack(4)
6173        typedef struct {
6174           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6175           NDR_record_t NDR;
6176           kern_return_t RetCode;
6177           mach_vm_address_t address;
6178           mach_vm_size_t size;
6179           natural_t nesting_depth;
6180           mach_msg_type_number_t infoCnt;
6181           int info[19];
6182        } Reply;
6183     #pragma pack()
6184     
6185        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
6186     
6187        if (!reply->RetCode) {
6188            PRINT("got region at 0x%llx, size %llu, depth %u, count %u", 
6189                  reply->address, reply->size, 
6190                  reply->nesting_depth, reply->infoCnt);
6191            // GrP fixme mark info contents beyond infoCnt as bogus
6192        } else {
6193           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
6194        }
6195     }
6196     
6197     
6198     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
6199        mach_msg: messages to thread
6200        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
6201     
6202     
6203     
6204     POST(thread_terminate)
6205     {
6206     }
6207     
6208     
6209     PRE(thread_terminate)
6210     {
6211        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6212        Bool self_terminate = (mh->msgh_request_port == MACH_THREAD);
6213     
6214        PRINT("thread_terminate(%s)", name_for_port(mh->msgh_request_port));
6215     
6216        AFTER = POST_FN(thread_terminate);
6217     
6218        if (self_terminate) {
6219           // Terminating this thread.
6220           // Copied from sys_exit.
6221           ThreadState *tst = VG_(get_ThreadState)(tid);
6222           tst->exitreason = VgSrc_ExitThread;
6223           tst->os_state.exitcode = 0;  // GrP fixme anything better?
6224           // What we would like to do is:
6225           //   SET_STATUS_Success(0);
6226           // but that doesn't work, because this is a MACH-class syscall,
6227           // and SET_STATUS_Success creates a UNIX-class syscall result.
6228           // Hence we have to laboriously construct the full SysRes "by hand"
6229           // and use that to set the syscall return status.
6230           SET_STATUS_from_SysRes(
6231              VG_(mk_SysRes_x86_darwin)(
6232                 VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CLASS_MACH,
6233                 False/*success*/, 0, 0
6234              )
6235           );
6236           *flags &= ~SfMayBlock;  // clear flag set by PRE(mach_msg)
6237        } else {
6238           // Terminating some other thread.
6239           // Do keep the scheduler lock while terminating any other thread. 
6240           // Otherwise we might halt the other thread while it holds the lock, 
6241           // which would deadlock the process.
6242           // GrP fixme good enough?
6243           // GrP fixme need to clean up other thread's valgrind data?
6244        }
6245     }
6246     
6247     
6248     POST(thread_create)
6249     {
6250     }
6251     
6252     
6253     PRE(thread_create)
6254     {
6255        PRINT("thread_create(mach_task_self(), ...)");
6256     
6257        AFTER = POST_FN(thread_create);
6258     
6259        // GrP fixme
6260        VG_(core_panic)("thread_create() unimplemented");
6261     }
6262     
6263     
6264     PRE(thread_create_running)
6265     {
6266     #pragma pack(4)
6267        typedef struct {
6268           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6269           NDR_record_t NDR;
6270           thread_state_flavor_t flavor;
6271           mach_msg_type_number_t new_stateCnt;
6272           natural_t new_state[144];
6273        } Request;
6274     #pragma pack()
6275        
6276        Request *req;
6277        thread_state_t regs;
6278        ThreadState *new_thread;
6279        
6280        PRINT("thread_create_running(mach_task_self(), ...)");
6281        
6282        // The new thread will immediately begin execution, 
6283        // so we need to hijack the register state here.
6284        
6285        req = (Request *)ARG1;
6286        regs = (thread_state_t)req->new_state;
6287        
6288        // Build virtual thread.
6289        new_thread = build_thread(regs, req->flavor, req->new_stateCnt);
6290        
6291        // Edit the thread state to send to the real kernel.
6292        hijack_thread_state(regs, req->flavor, req->new_stateCnt, new_thread);
6293     
6294        AFTER = POST_FN(thread_create_running);
6295     }
6296     
6297     
6298     POST(thread_create_running)
6299     {
6300     #pragma pack(4)
6301        typedef struct {
6302           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6303           /* start of the kernel processed data */
6304           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
6305           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t child_act;
6306           /* end of the kernel processed data */
6307        } Reply;
6308     #pragma pack()
6309        
6310        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
6311     
6312        assign_port_name(reply->child_act.name, "thread-%p");
6313        PRINT("%s", name_for_port(reply->child_act.name));
6314     }
6315     
6316     
6317     PRE(bsdthread_create)
6318     {
6319        ThreadState *tst;
6320     
6321        PRINT("bsdthread_create( %#lx, %#lx, %#lx, %#lx, %#lx )", 
6322              ARG1, ARG2, ARG3, ARG4, ARG5);
6323        PRE_REG_READ5(pthread_t,"bsdthread_create", 
6324                      void *,"func", void *,"func_arg", void *,"stack", 
6325                      pthread_t,"thread", unsigned int,"flags");
6326     
6327        // The kernel will call V's pthread_hijack() to launch the thread.
6328        // Here we allocate the thread state and pass it to pthread_hijack()
6329        // via the func_arg parameter.
6330        
6331        tst = VG_(get_ThreadState)(VG_(alloc_ThreadState)());
6332        allocstack(tst->tid);
6333     
6334        tst->os_state.func_arg = (Addr)ARG2;
6335        ARG2 = (Word)tst;
6336     
6337        // Create a semaphore that pthread_hijack will signal once it starts
6338        // POST(bsdthread_create) needs to wait for the new memory map to appear
6339        semaphore_create(mach_task_self(), &tst->os_state.child_go, 
6340                         SYNC_POLICY_FIFO, 0);
6341        semaphore_create(mach_task_self(), &tst->os_state.child_done, 
6342                         SYNC_POLICY_FIFO, 0);
6343     }
6344     
6345     POST(bsdthread_create)
6346     { 
6347        // Tell new thread's pthread_hijack to proceed, and wait for it to finish.
6348        // We hold V's lock on the child's behalf.
6349        // If we return before letting pthread_hijack do its thing, V thinks 
6350        // the new pthread struct is still unmapped when we return to libc, 
6351        // causing false errors.
6352     
6353        ThreadState *tst = (ThreadState *)ARG2;
6354        semaphore_signal(tst->os_state.child_go);
6355        semaphore_wait(tst->os_state.child_done);
6356        semaphore_destroy(mach_task_self(), tst->os_state.child_go);
6357        semaphore_destroy(mach_task_self(), tst->os_state.child_done);
6358     
6359        // GrP fixme semaphore destroy needed when thread creation fails
6360        // GrP fixme probably other cleanup too
6361        // GrP fixme spinlocks might be good enough?
6362     
6363        // DDD: I'm not at all sure this is the right spot for this.  It probably
6364        // should be in pthread_hijack instead, just before the call to
6365        // start_thread_NORETURN(), call_on_new_stack_0_1(), but we don't have the
6366        // parent tid value there...
6367        VG_TRACK ( pre_thread_ll_create, tid, tst->tid );
6368     }
6369     
6370     
6371     PRE(bsdthread_terminate)
6372     {
6373        ThreadState *tst;
6374     
6375        PRINT("bsdthread_terminate( %#lx, %lx, %s, %s )", 
6376              ARG1, ARG2, name_for_port(ARG3), name_for_port(ARG4));
6377        PRE_REG_READ4(int,"bsdthread_terminate", 
6378                      void *,"freeaddr", size_t,"freesize", 
6379                      mach_port_t,"kport", mach_port_t,"joinsem");
6380     
6381        // Free memory and signal semaphore.
6382        // GrP fixme errors?
6383        if (ARG4) semaphore_signal((semaphore_t)ARG4);
6384        if (ARG1  &&  ARG2) {
6385            ML_(notify_core_and_tool_of_munmap)(ARG1, ARG2);
6386            vm_deallocate(mach_task_self(), (vm_address_t)ARG1, (vm_size_t)ARG2);
6387        }
6388     
6389        // Tell V to terminate the thread.
6390        // Copied from sys_exit.
6391        tst = VG_(get_ThreadState)(tid);
6392        tst->exitreason = VgSrc_ExitThread;
6393        tst->os_state.exitcode = 0;  // GrP fixme anything better?
6394        SET_STATUS_Success(0);
6395     }
6396     
6397     
6398     POST(thread_suspend)
6399     {
6400     }
6401     
6402     PRE(thread_suspend)
6403     {
6404        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6405        Bool self_suspend = (mh->msgh_request_port == MACH_THREAD);
6406     
6407        PRINT("thread_suspend(%s)", name_for_port(mh->msgh_request_port));
6408     
6409        AFTER = POST_FN(thread_suspend);
6410     
6411        if (self_suspend) {
6412            // Don't keep the scheduler lock while self-suspending.
6413            // Otherwise we might halt while still holding the lock, 
6414            // which would deadlock the process.
6415            *flags |= SfMayBlock;
6416        } else {
6417            // Do keep the scheduler lock while suspending any other thread. 
6418            // Otherwise we might halt the other thread while it holds the lock, 
6419            // which would deadlock the process.
6420        }
6421     }
6422     
6423     
6424     POST(thread_get_state)
6425     {
6426     #pragma pack(4)
6427        typedef struct {
6428           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6429           NDR_record_t NDR;
6430           kern_return_t RetCode;
6431           mach_msg_type_number_t old_stateCnt;
6432           natural_t old_state[144];
6433           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
6434        } Reply;
6435     #pragma pack()
6436     
6437        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
6438        // mach_port_t thread = MACH_ARG(thread_get_state.thread);
6439        thread_state_flavor_t flavor = MACH_ARG(thread_get_state.flavor);
6440     
6441        if (!reply->RetCode) {
6442           thread_state_from_vex((thread_state_t)reply->old_state, 
6443                                  flavor, reply->old_stateCnt, 
6444                                  &VG_(get_ThreadState)(tid)->arch.vex);
6445        } else {
6446           PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
6447        }
6448     }
6449     
6450     PRE(thread_get_state)
6451     {
6452     #pragma pack(4)
6453        typedef struct {
6454           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6455           NDR_record_t NDR;
6456           thread_state_flavor_t flavor;
6457           mach_msg_type_number_t old_stateCnt;
6458        } Request;
6459     #pragma pack()
6460         
6461        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
6462        // Bool self = (req->Head.msgh_request_port == MACH_THREAD);
6463     
6464        // GrP fixme   if (self) {
6465        PRINT("thread_get_state(%s, %d)", 
6466              name_for_port(req->Head.msgh_request_port), req->flavor);
6467            /*} else {
6468            PRINT("thread_get_state(0x%x, %d)", 
6469                  req->Head.msgh_request_port, req->flavor);
6470                  }*/
6471     
6472        // Hack the thread state after making the real call.
6473        MACH_ARG(thread_get_state.thread) = req->Head.msgh_request_port;
6474        MACH_ARG(thread_get_state.flavor) = req->flavor;
6475     
6476        AFTER = POST_FN(thread_get_state);
6477     }
6478     
6479     
6480     PRE(thread_policy)
6481     {
6482        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6483        // Bool self = (mh->msgh_request_port == MACH_THREAD);
6484     
6485        // GrP fixme   if (self) {
6486           PRINT("thread_policy(%s, ...)", name_for_port(mh->msgh_request_port));
6487           /*} else {
6488           PRINT("thread_policy(thread 0x%x, ...)", mh->msgh_request_port);
6489           }*/
6490     
6491        AFTER = POST_FN(thread_policy);
6492     }
6493     
6494     POST(thread_policy)
6495     {
6496     }
6497     
6498     
6499     PRE(thread_policy_set)
6500     {
6501        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6502     
6503        PRINT("thread_policy_set(%s, ...)", name_for_port(mh->msgh_request_port));
6504     
6505        AFTER = POST_FN(thread_policy_set);
6506     }
6507     
6508     POST(thread_policy_set)
6509     {
6510     }
6511     
6512     
6513     PRE(thread_info)
6514     {
6515        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6516     
6517        PRINT("thread_info(%s, ...)", name_for_port(mh->msgh_request_port));
6518        // GrP fixme does any thread info need to be hijacked?
6519     
6520        AFTER = POST_FN(thread_info);
6521     }
6522     
6523     POST(thread_info)
6524     {
6525        // GrP fixme mark unused parts of thread_info_out as uninitialized?
6526     }
6527     
6528     
6529     
6530     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
6531        mach_msg: messages to bootstrap port
6532        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
6533     
6534     
6535     POST(bootstrap_register)
6536     {
6537     #pragma pack(4)
6538        typedef struct {
6539           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6540           NDR_record_t NDR;
6541           kern_return_t RetCode;
6542           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
6543        } Reply;
6544     #pragma pack()
6545     
6546        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
6547     
6548        if (reply->RetCode) PRINT("mig return %d", reply->RetCode);
6549     }
6550     
6551     PRE(bootstrap_register)
6552     {
6553     #pragma pack(4)
6554        typedef struct {
6555           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6556           /* start of the kernel processed data */
6557           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
6558           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t service_port;
6559           /* end of the kernel processed data */
6560           NDR_record_t NDR;
6561           name_t service_name;
6562        } Request;
6563     #pragma pack()
6564     
6565        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
6566     
6567        PRINT("bootstrap_register(port 0x%x, \"%s\")",
6568              req->service_port.name, req->service_name);
6569     
6570        assign_port_name(req->service_port.name, req->service_name);
6571     
6572        AFTER = POST_FN(bootstrap_register);
6573     }
6574     
6575     
6576     POST(bootstrap_look_up)
6577     {
6578     #pragma pack(4)
6579        typedef struct {
6580           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6581           /* start of the kernel processed data */
6582           mach_msg_body_t msgh_body;
6583           mach_msg_port_descriptor_t service_port;
6584           /* end of the kernel processed data */
6585           mach_msg_trailer_t trailer;
6586        } Reply;
6587     #pragma pack()
6588     
6589        Reply *reply = (Reply *)ARG1;
6590     
6591        if ((reply->Head.msgh_bits & MACH_MSGH_BITS_COMPLEX)  &&  
6592            reply->service_port.name) 
6593        {
6594            assign_port_name(reply->service_port.name, 
6595                             MACH_ARG(bootstrap_look_up.service_name));
6596            PRINT("%s", name_for_port(reply->service_port.name));
6597        } else {
6598            PRINT("not found");
6599        }
6600        VG_(arena_free)(VG_AR_CORE, MACH_ARG(bootstrap_look_up.service_name));
6601     }
6602     
6603     PRE(bootstrap_look_up)
6604     {
6605     #pragma pack(4)
6606        typedef struct {
6607           mach_msg_header_t Head;
6608           NDR_record_t NDR;
6609           name_t service_name;
6610        } Request;
6611     #pragma pack()
6612     
6613        Request *req = (Request *)ARG1;
6614     
6615        PRINT("bootstrap_look_up(\"%s\")", req->service_name);
6616     
6617        MACH_ARG(bootstrap_look_up.service_name) =
6618           VG_(arena_strdup)(VG_AR_CORE, "syswrap-darwin.bootstrap-name", 
6619                             req->service_name);
6620     
6621        AFTER = POST_FN(bootstrap_look_up);
6622     }
6623     
6624     
6625     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
6626        mach_msg: receiver-specific handlers
6627        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
6628     
6629     
6630     POST(mach_msg_receive)
6631     {
6632        // mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6633     
6634        // GrP fixme don't know of anything interesting here currently
6635        // import_complex_message handles everything
6636        // PRINT("UNHANDLED reply %d", mh->msgh_id);
6637     
6638        // Assume the call may have mapped or unmapped memory
6639        ML_(sync_mappings)("after", "mach_msg_receive", 0);
6640     }
6641     
6642     PRE(mach_msg_receive)
6643     {
6644        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6645        
6646        PRINT("mach_msg_receive(port %s)", name_for_port(mh->msgh_reply_port));
6647        
6648        AFTER = POST_FN(mach_msg_receive);
6649     
6650        // no message sent, only listening for a reply
6651        // assume message may block
6652        *flags |= SfMayBlock;
6653     }
6654     
6655     
6656     PRE(mach_msg_bootstrap)
6657     {
6658        // message to bootstrap port
6659     
6660        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6661        
6662        switch (mh->msgh_id) {
6663        case 403:
6664           CALL_PRE(bootstrap_register);
6665           return;
6666        case 404:
6667           CALL_PRE(bootstrap_look_up);
6668           return;
6669           
6670        default:
6671           PRINT("UNHANDLED bootstrap message [id %d, to %s, reply 0x%x]\n", 
6672                 mh->msgh_id, name_for_port(mh->msgh_request_port),
6673                 mh->msgh_reply_port);
6674           return;
6675        }
6676     }
6677     
6678     
6679     PRE(mach_msg_host)
6680     {
6681        // message to host self - check for host-level kernel calls
6682     
6683        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6684     
6685        switch (mh->msgh_id) {
6686        case 200:
6687           CALL_PRE(host_info);
6688           return;
6689        case 202:
6690           CALL_PRE(host_page_size);
6691           return;
6692        case 205:
6693           CALL_PRE(host_get_io_master);
6694           return;
6695        case 206:
6696           CALL_PRE(host_get_clock_service);
6697           return;
6698        case 217:
6699           CALL_PRE(host_request_notification);
6700           return;
6701     
6702        default:
6703           // unknown message to host self
6704           VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN host message [id %d, to %s, reply 0x%x]\n", 
6705                       mh->msgh_id, name_for_port(mh->msgh_request_port), 
6706                       mh->msgh_reply_port);
6707           return;
6708        }
6709     } 
6710     
6711     PRE(mach_msg_task)
6712     {
6713        // message to a task port
6714     
6715        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6716     
6717        switch (mh->msgh_id) {
6718        case 3201:
6719           CALL_PRE(mach_port_type);
6720           return;
6721        case 3204:
6722           CALL_PRE(mach_port_allocate);
6723           return;
6724        case 3205:
6725           CALL_PRE(mach_port_destroy);
6726           return;
6727        case 3206:
6728           CALL_PRE(mach_port_deallocate);
6729           return;
6730        case 3207:
6731           CALL_PRE(mach_port_get_refs);
6732           return;
6733        case 3208:
6734           CALL_PRE(mach_port_mod_refs);
6735           return;
6736        case 3211:
6737           CALL_PRE(mach_port_get_set_status);
6738           return;
6739        case 3212:
6740           CALL_PRE(mach_port_move_member);
6741           return;
6742        case 3213:
6743           CALL_PRE(mach_port_request_notification);
6744           return;
6745        case 3214:
6746           CALL_PRE(mach_port_insert_right);
6747           return;
6748        case 3215:
6749           CALL_PRE(mach_port_extract_right);
6750           return;
6751        case 3217:
6752           CALL_PRE(mach_port_get_attributes);
6753           return;
6754        case 3218:
6755           CALL_PRE(mach_port_set_attributes);
6756           return;
6757        case 3226:
6758           CALL_PRE(mach_port_insert_member);
6759           return;
6760        case 3227:
6761           CALL_PRE(mach_port_extract_member);
6762           return;
6763             
6764        case 3402:
6765           CALL_PRE(task_threads);
6766           return;
6767        case 3404:
6768           CALL_PRE(mach_ports_lookup);
6769           return;
6770     
6771        case 3407:
6772           CALL_PRE(task_suspend);
6773           return;
6774        case 3408:
6775           CALL_PRE(task_resume);
6776           return;
6777           
6778        case 3409:
6779           CALL_PRE(task_get_special_port);
6780           return;
6781        case 3411:
6782           CALL_PRE(thread_create);
6783           return;
6784        case 3412:
6785           CALL_PRE(thread_create_running);
6786           return;
6787           
6788        case 3418:
6789           CALL_PRE(semaphore_create);
6790           return;
6791        case 3419:
6792           CALL_PRE(semaphore_destroy);
6793           return;
6794           
6795        case 3801:
6796           CALL_PRE(vm_allocate);
6797           return;
6798        case 3802:
6799           CALL_PRE(vm_deallocate);
6800           return;
6801        case 3803:
6802           CALL_PRE(vm_protect);
6803           return;
6804        case 3804:
6805           CALL_PRE(vm_inherit);
6806           return;
6807        case 3805:
6808           CALL_PRE(vm_read);
6809           return;
6810        case 3808:
6811           CALL_PRE(vm_copy);
6812           return;
6813        case 3809:
6814           CALL_PRE(vm_read_overwrite);
6815           return;
6816        case 3812:
6817           CALL_PRE(vm_map);
6818           return;
6819        case 3814:
6820           CALL_PRE(vm_remap);
6821           return;
6822        case 3825:
6823           CALL_PRE(mach_make_memory_entry_64);
6824           return;
6825        case 3830:
6826           CALL_PRE(vm_purgable_control);
6827           return;
6828     
6829        case 4800:
6830           CALL_PRE(mach_vm_allocate);
6831           return;
6832        case 4801:
6833           CALL_PRE(mach_vm_deallocate);
6834           return;
6835        case 4802:
6836           CALL_PRE(mach_vm_protect);
6837           return;
6838        case 4803:
6839           CALL_PRE(mach_vm_inherit);
6840           return;
6841        case 4804:
6842           CALL_PRE(mach_vm_read);
6843           return;
6844        case 4807:
6845           CALL_PRE(mach_vm_copy);
6846           return;
6847        case 4811:
6848           CALL_PRE(mach_vm_map);
6849           return;
6850        case 4815:
6851           CALL_PRE(mach_vm_region_recurse);
6852           return;
6853        case 4817:
6854           CALL_PRE(mach_make_memory_entry_64);
6855           return;
6856        case 4818:
6857           CALL_PRE(mach_vm_purgable_control);
6858           return;
6859     
6860        default:
6861           // unknown message to task self
6862           VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN task message [id %d, to %s, reply 0x%x]\n",
6863                       mh->msgh_id, name_for_port(mh->msgh_remote_port),
6864                       mh->msgh_reply_port);
6865           return;
6866        }
6867     } 
6868     
6869     
6870     PRE(mach_msg_thread)
6871     {
6872        // message to local thread - check for thread-level kernel calls
6873     
6874        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6875     
6876        switch (mh->msgh_id) {
6877        case 3600: 
6878           CALL_PRE(thread_terminate);
6879           return;
6880        case 3603:
6881           CALL_PRE(thread_get_state);
6882           return;
6883        case 3605: 
6884           CALL_PRE(thread_suspend);
6885           return;
6886        case 3612: 
6887           CALL_PRE(thread_info);
6888           return;
6889        case 3616: 
6890           CALL_PRE(thread_policy);
6891           return;
6892        case 3617: 
6893           CALL_PRE(thread_policy_set);
6894           return;
6895        default:
6896           // unknown message to a thread
6897           VG_(printf)("UNKNOWN thread message [id %d, to %s, reply 0x%x]\n", 
6898                       mh->msgh_id, name_for_port(mh->msgh_request_port), 
6899                       mh->msgh_reply_port);
6900           return;
6901        }
6902     }
6903     
6904     
6905     static int is_thread_port(mach_port_t port)
6906     {
6907        if (port == 0) return False;
6908     
6909        return VG_(lwpid_to_vgtid)(port) != VG_INVALID_THREADID;
6910     }
6911     
6912     
6913     static int is_task_port(mach_port_t port)
6914     {
6915        if (port == 0) return False;
6916     
6917        if (port == vg_task_port) return True;
6918     
6919        return (0 == VG_(strncmp)("task-", name_for_port(port), 5));
6920     }
6921     
6922     
6923     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
6924        mach_msg: base handlers
6925        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
6926     
6927     PRE(mach_msg)
6928     {
6929        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
6930        mach_msg_option_t option = (mach_msg_option_t)ARG2;
6931        // mach_msg_size_t send_size = (mach_msg_size_t)ARG3;
6932        mach_msg_size_t rcv_size = (mach_msg_size_t)ARG4;
6933        // mach_port_t rcv_name = (mach_port_t)ARG5;
6934        size_t complex_header_size = 0;
6935     
6936        PRE_REG_READ7(long, "mach_msg", 
6937                      mach_msg_header_t*,"msg", mach_msg_option_t,"option", 
6938                      mach_msg_size_t,"send_size", mach_msg_size_t,"rcv_size", 
6939                      mach_port_t,"rcv_name", mach_msg_timeout_t,"timeout", 
6940                      mach_port_t,"notify");
6941     
6942        // Assume default POST handler until specified otherwise
6943        AFTER = NULL;
6944     
6945        // Assume call may block unless specified otherwise
6946        *flags |= SfMayBlock;
6947     
6948        if (option & MACH_SEND_MSG) {
6949           // Validate outgoing message header
6950           PRE_MEM_READ("mach_msg(msg.msgh_bits)", 
6951                        (Addr)&mh->msgh_bits, sizeof(mh->msgh_bits));
6952           // msgh_size not required, use parameter instead
6953           PRE_MEM_READ("mach_msg(msg.msgh_remote_port)", 
6954                        (Addr)&mh->msgh_remote_port, sizeof(mh->msgh_remote_port));
6955           PRE_MEM_READ("mach_msg(msg.msgh_local_port)", 
6956                        (Addr)&mh->msgh_local_port, sizeof(mh->msgh_local_port));
6957           // msgh_reserved not required
6958           PRE_MEM_READ("mach_msg(msg.msgh_id)", 
6959                        (Addr)&mh->msgh_id, sizeof(mh->msgh_id));
6960           
6961           if (mh->msgh_bits & MACH_MSGH_BITS_COMPLEX) {
6962              // Validate typed message data and handle memory map changes.
6963              complex_header_size = export_complex_message(tid, mh);
6964           }
6965     
6966           // GrP fixme handle sender-specified message trailer
6967           // (but is this only for too-secure processes?)
6968           vg_assert(! (mh->msgh_bits & MACH_SEND_TRAILER));
6969     
6970           MACH_REMOTE = mh->msgh_remote_port;
6971           MACH_MSGH_ID = mh->msgh_id;
6972        }
6973     
6974        if (option & MACH_RCV_MSG) {
6975           // Pre-validate receive buffer
6976           PRE_MEM_WRITE("mach_msg(receive buffer)", (Addr)mh, rcv_size);
6977        }
6978     
6979        // Call a PRE handler. The PRE handler may set an AFTER handler.
6980     
6981        if (!(option & MACH_SEND_MSG)) {
6982           // no message sent, receive only
6983           CALL_PRE(mach_msg_receive);
6984           return;
6985        }
6986        else if (mh->msgh_request_port == vg_host_port) {
6987           // message sent to mach_host_self()
6988           CALL_PRE(mach_msg_host);
6989           return;
6990        }
6991        else if (is_task_port(mh->msgh_request_port)) {
6992           // message sent to a task
6993           CALL_PRE(mach_msg_task);
6994           return;
6995        }
6996        else if (mh->msgh_request_port == vg_bootstrap_port) {
6997           // message sent to bootstrap port
6998           CALL_PRE(mach_msg_bootstrap);
6999           return;
7000        }
7001        else if (is_thread_port(mh->msgh_request_port)) {
7002           // message sent to one of this process's threads
7003           CALL_PRE(mach_msg_thread);
7004           return;
7005        }
7006        else {
7007           // arbitrary message to arbitrary port
7008           PRINT("UNHANDLED mach_msg [id %d, to %s, reply 0x%x]", 
7009                 mh->msgh_id, name_for_port(mh->msgh_request_port), 
7010                 mh->msgh_reply_port);
7011     
7012           AFTER = POST_FN(mach_msg_unhandled);
7013     
7014           // Assume the entire message body may be read.
7015           // GrP fixme generates false positives for unknown protocols
7016           /*
7017           PRE_MEM_READ("mach_msg(payload)", 
7018                        (Addr)((char*)mh + sizeof(mach_msg_header_t) + complex_header_size), 
7019                        send_size - sizeof(mach_msg_header_t) - complex_header_size);
7020           */
7021           return;
7022        }
7023     }
7024     
7025     POST(mach_msg)
7026     {
7027        mach_msg_header_t *mh = (mach_msg_header_t *)ARG1;
7028        mach_msg_option_t option = (mach_msg_option_t)ARG2;
7029     
7030        if (option & MACH_RCV_MSG) {
7031           if (RES != 0) {
7032              // error during send or receive
7033              // GrP fixme need to clean up port rights?
7034           } else {
7035              mach_msg_trailer_t *mt = 
7036                  (mach_msg_trailer_t *)((Addr)mh + round_msg(mh->msgh_size));
7037                
7038              // Assume the entire received message and trailer is initialized
7039              // GrP fixme would being more specific catch any bugs?
7040              POST_MEM_WRITE((Addr)mh, 
7041                             round_msg(mh->msgh_size) + mt->msgh_trailer_size);
7042              
7043              if (mh->msgh_bits & MACH_MSGH_BITS_COMPLEX) {
7044                  // Update memory map for out-of-line message data
7045                  import_complex_message(tid, mh);
7046              }
7047           }
7048        }
7049        
7050        // Call handler chosen by PRE(mach_msg)
7051        if (AFTER) {
7052           (*AFTER)(tid, arrghs, status);
7053        }
7054     }
7055     
7056     
7057     POST(mach_msg_unhandled)
7058     {
7059        ML_(sync_mappings)("after", "mach_msg_receive (unhandled)", 0);
7060     }
7061     
7062     
7063     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
7064        other Mach traps
7065        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
7066     
7067     PRE(mach_reply_port)
7068     {
7069        PRINT("mach_reply_port()");
7070     }
7071     
7072     POST(mach_reply_port)
7073     {
7074        record_named_port(tid, RES, MACH_PORT_RIGHT_RECEIVE, "reply-%p");
7075        PRINT("reply port %s", name_for_port(RES));
7076     }
7077     
7078     
7079     PRE(mach_thread_self)
7080     {
7081        PRINT("mach_thread_self()");
7082     }
7083     
7084     POST(mach_thread_self)
7085     {
7086        record_named_port(tid, RES, MACH_PORT_RIGHT_SEND, "thread-%p");
7087        PRINT("thread %#lx", RES);
7088     }
7089     
7090     
7091     PRE(mach_host_self)
7092     {
7093        PRINT("mach_host_self()");
7094     }
7095     
7096     POST(mach_host_self)
7097     {
7098        vg_host_port = RES;
7099        record_named_port(tid, RES, MACH_PORT_RIGHT_SEND, "mach_host_self()");
7100        PRINT("host %#lx", RES);
7101     }
7102     
7103     
7104     PRE(mach_task_self)
7105     {
7106        PRINT("mach_task_self()");
7107     }
7108     
7109     POST(mach_task_self)
7110     {
7111        vg_task_port = RES;
7112        record_named_port(tid, RES, MACH_PORT_RIGHT_SEND, "mach_task_self()");
7113        PRINT("task %#lx", RES);
7114     }
7115     
7116     
7117     PRE(syscall_thread_switch)
7118     {
7119        PRINT("syscall_thread_switch(%s, %ld, %ld)",
7120           name_for_port(ARG1), ARG2, ARG3);
7121        PRE_REG_READ3(long, "syscall_thread_switch", 
7122                      mach_port_t,"thread", int,"option", natural_t,"timeout");
7123     
7124        *flags |= SfMayBlock;
7125     }
7126     
7127

7130        PRINT("semaphore_signal(%s)", name_for_port(ARG1));
7131        PRE_REG_READ1(long, "semaphore_signal", semaphore_t,"semaphore");
7132     }

7157     }

7190                      semaphore_t,"wait_semaphore", 
7191                      semaphore_t,"signal_semaphore", 
7192                      int,"wait_time_hi", 
7193                      int,"wait_time_lo");
7194     
7195        *flags |= SfMayBlock;
7196     }

7198     
7199     PRE(__semwait_signal)
7200     {
7201        /* 10.5 args: int cond_sem, int mutex_sem,
7202                      int timeout, int relative,
7203                      time_t tv_sec, time_t tv_nsec */
7204        PRINT("__semwait_signal(wait %s, signal %s, %ld, %ld, %lds:%ldns)", 
7205              name_for_port(ARG1), name_for_port(ARG2), ARG3, ARG4, ARG5, ARG6);
7206        PRE_REG_READ6(long, "__semwait_signal", 
7207                      int,"cond_sem", int,"mutex_sem",
7208                      int,"timeout", int,"relative", 
7209                      vki_time_t,"tv_sec", int,"tv_nsec");
7210     
7211        *flags |= SfMayBlock;
7212     }
7213     // GrP provided this alternative version for 10.6, but NjN
7214     // reckons the 10.5 is is still correct for 10.6.  So, retaining
7215     // Greg's version as a comment just in case we need it later.
7216     //PRE(__semwait_signal)
7217     //{
7218     //   /* 10.5 args: int cond_sem, int mutex_sem,
7219     //                 int timeout, int relative,
7220     //                 const timespec *ts */
7221     //   PRINT("__semwait_signal(wait %s, signal %s, %ld, %ld, %#lx)", 
7222     //         name_for_port(ARG1), name_for_port(ARG2), ARG3, ARG4, ARG5);
7223     //   PRE_REG_READ5(int, "__semwait_signal", 
7224     //                 int,cond_sem, int,mutex_sem,
7225     //                 int,timeout, int,relative, 
7226     //                 const struct vki_timespec *,ts);
7227     //   
7228     //   if (ARG5) PRE_MEM_READ ("__semwait_signal(ts)", 
7229     //                           ARG5, sizeof(struct vki_timespec));
7230     //   
7231     //   *flags |= SfMayBlock;
7232     //}
7233

7235     PRE(__thread_selfid)
7236     {
7237        PRINT("__thread_selfid ()");
7238        PRE_REG_READ0(vki_uint64_t, "__thread_selfid");
7239     }

7241     PRE(task_for_pid)
7242     {
7243        PRINT("task_for_pid(%s, %ld, %#lx)", name_for_port(ARG1), ARG2, ARG3);
7244        PRE_REG_READ3(long, "task_for_pid", 
7245                      mach_port_t,"target", 
7246                      vki_pid_t, "pid", mach_port_t *,"task");
7247        PRE_MEM_WRITE("task_for_pid(task)", ARG3, sizeof(mach_port_t));
7248     }
7249     
7250     POST(task_for_pid)
7251     {
7252        mach_port_t task;
7253     
7254        POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG3, sizeof(mach_port_t));
7255     
7256        task = *(mach_port_t *)ARG3;
7257        record_named_port(tid, task, MACH_PORT_RIGHT_SEND, "task-%p");
7258        PRINT("task 0x%x", task);
7259     }
7260     
7261     
7262     PRE(pid_for_task)
7263     {
7264        PRINT("pid_for_task(%s, %#lx)", name_for_port(ARG1), ARG2);
7265        PRE_REG_READ2(long, "task_for_pid", mach_port_t,"task", vki_pid_t *,"pid");
7266        PRE_MEM_WRITE("task_for_pid(pid)", ARG2, sizeof(vki_pid_t));
7267     }
7268     
7269     POST(pid_for_task)
7270     {
7271        vki_pid_t pid;
7272     
7273        POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG2, sizeof(vki_pid_t));
7274     
7275        pid = *(vki_pid_t *)ARG2;
7276        PRINT("pid %u", pid);
7277     }

7315     {
7316        record_named_port(tid, RES, MACH_PORT_RIGHT_SEND, "mk_timer-%p");
7317     }
7318     
7319     
7320     PRE(mk_timer_destroy)
7321     {
7322        PRINT("mk_timer_destroy(%s)", name_for_port(ARG1));
7323        PRE_REG_READ1(long, "mk_timer_destroy", mach_port_t,"name");
7324     
7325        // Must block to prevent race (other thread allocates and 
7326        // notifies after we deallocate but before we notify)
7327        *flags &= ~SfMayBlock;
7328     }
7329     
7330     POST(mk_timer_destroy)
7331     {
7332        // Must have cleared SfMayBlock in PRE to prevent race
7333        record_port_destroy(ARG1);
7334     }
7335     
7336     
7337     PRE(mk_timer_arm)
7338     {
7339     #if VG_WORDSIZE == 8
7340        PRINT("mk_timer_arm(%s, %lu)", name_for_port(ARG1), ARG2);
7341        PRE_REG_READ2(long, "mk_timer_arm", mach_port_t,"name", 
7342                      unsigned long,"expire_time");
7343     #else
7344        PRINT("mk_timer_arm(%s, %llu)", name_for_port(ARG1), LOHI64(ARG2, ARG3));
7345        PRE_REG_READ3(long, "mk_timer_arm", mach_port_t,"name", 
7346                      int,"expire_time_hi", int,"expire_time_lo");
7347     #endif
7348     }
7349     
7350     
7351     PRE(mk_timer_cancel)
7352     {
7353        PRINT("mk_timer_cancel(%s, %#lx)", name_for_port(ARG1), ARG2);
7354        PRE_REG_READ2(long, "mk_timer_cancel", 
7355                      mach_port_t,"name", Addr,"result_time");
7356        if (ARG2) {
7357           PRE_MEM_WRITE("mk_timer_cancel(result_time)", ARG2,sizeof(vki_uint64_t));
7358        }
7359     }
7360     
7361     POST(mk_timer_cancel)
7362     {
7363        if (ARG2) {
7364           POST_MEM_WRITE(ARG2, sizeof(vki_uint64_t));
7365        }
7366     }
7367     
7368     
7369     PRE(iokit_user_client_trap)
7370     {
7371        PRINT("iokit_user_client_trap(%s, %ld, %lx, %lx, %lx, %lx, %lx, %lx)",
7372              name_for_port(ARG1), ARG2, ARG3, ARG4, ARG5, ARG6, ARG7, ARG8);
7373        PRE_REG_READ8(kern_return_t, "iokit_user_client_trap", 
7374                      mach_port_t,connect, unsigned int,index, 
7375                      uintptr_t,p1, uintptr_t,p2, uintptr_t,p3, 
7376                      uintptr_t,p4, uintptr_t,p5, uintptr_t,p6);
7377     
7378        // can't do anything else with this in general
7379        // might be able to use connect+index to choose something sometimes
7380     }
7381     
7382     POST(iokit_user_client_trap)
7383     {
7384        ML_(sync_mappings)("after", "iokit_user_client_trap", ARG2);
7385     }
7386

7389     {
7390        PRINT("swtch ( )");
7391        PRE_REG_READ0(long, "swtch");
7392     
7393        *flags |= SfMayBlock;
7394     }
7395     
7396     
7397     PRE(swtch_pri)
7398     {
7399        PRINT("swtch_pri ( %ld )", ARG1);
7400        PRE_REG_READ1(long, "swtch_pri", int,"pri");
7401     
7402        *flags |= SfMayBlock;
7403     }
7404     
7405     
7406     PRE(FAKE_SIGRETURN)
7407     {
7408        /* See comments on PRE(sys_rt_sigreturn) in syswrap-amd64-linux.c for
7409           an explanation of what follows. */
7410        /* This handles the fake signal-return system call created by
7411           sigframe-x86-darwin.c. */
7412        /* See also comments just below on PRE(sigreturn). */
7413     
7414        PRINT("FAKE_SIGRETURN ( )");
7415     
7416        vg_assert(VG_(is_valid_tid)(tid));
7417        vg_assert(tid >= 1 && tid < VG_N_THREADS);
7418        vg_assert(VG_(is_running_thread)(tid));
7419     
7420        /* Remove the signal frame from this thread's (guest) stack,
7421           in the process restoring the pre-signal guest state. */
7422        VG_(sigframe_destroy)(tid, True);
7423     
7424        /* Tell the driver not to update the guest state with the "result",
7425           and set a bogus result to keep it happy. */
7426        *flags |= SfNoWriteResult;
7427        SET_STATUS_Success(0);
7428     
7429        /* Check to see if any signals arose as a result of this. */
7430        *flags |= SfPollAfter;
7431     }
7432     
7433     
7434     PRE(sigreturn)
7435     {
7436        /* This is the "real" sigreturn.  But because we construct all the
7437           signal frames ourselves (of course, in m_sigframe), this cannot
7438           happen as a result of normal signal delivery.  I think it
7439           happens only when doing siglongjmp, in which case Darwin's Libc
7440           appears to use it for two different purposes: to mess with the
7441           per-thread sigaltstack flags (as per arg 2), or to restore the
7442           thread's state from a ucontext* (as per arg 1). */
7443     
7444        PRINT("sigreturn ( uctx=%#lx, infostyle=%#lx )", ARG1, ARG2);
7445     
7446        vg_assert(VG_(is_valid_tid)(tid));
7447        vg_assert(tid >= 1 && tid < VG_N_THREADS);
7448        vg_assert(VG_(is_running_thread)(tid));
7449     
7450        if (ARG2 == VKI_UC_SET_ALT_STACK) {
7451           /* This is confusing .. the darwin kernel sources imply there is
7452              a per-thread on-altstack/not-on-altstack flag, which is set
7453              by this flag.  Just ignore it and claim success for the time
7454              being. */
7455           VG_(debugLog)(0, "syswrap-darwin",
7456                            "WARNING: Ignoring sigreturn( ..., "
7457                            "UC_SET_ALT_STACK );\n");
7458           SET_STATUS_Success(0);
7459           return;
7460        }
7461        if (ARG2 == VKI_UC_RESET_ALT_STACK) {
7462           /* Ditto */
7463           VG_(debugLog)(0, "syswrap-darwin",
7464                            "WARNING: Ignoring sigreturn( ..., "
7465                            "UC_RESET_ALT_STACK );\n");
7466           SET_STATUS_Success(0);
7467           return;
7468        }
7469     
7470        /* Otherwise claim this isn't supported.  (Could be
7471           catastrophic).
7472     
7473           What do we have to do if we do need to support it?
7474     
7475           1. Change the second argument of VG_(sigframe_destroy) from
7476              "Bool isRT" to "UInt sysno", so we can pass the syscall
7477              number, so it can distinguish this case from the
7478              __NR_DARWIN_FAKE_SIGRETURN case.
7479     
7480           2. In VG_(sigframe_destroy), look at sysno to distinguish the
7481              cases.  For __NR_DARWIN_FAKE_SIGRETURN, behave as at present.
7482              For this case, restore the thread's CPU state (or at least
7483              the integer regs) from the ucontext in ARG1 (and do all the
7484              other "signal-returns" stuff too).
7485     
7486           3. For (2), how do we know where the ucontext is?  One way is to
7487              temporarily copy ARG1 into this thread's guest_EBX (or any
7488              other int reg), and have VG_(sigframe_destroy) read
7489              guest_EBX.  Why is it ok to trash guest_EBX (or any other int
7490              reg)?  Because VG_(sigframe_destroy) is just about to
7491              overwrite all the regs anyway -- since the primary purpose of
7492              calling it is to restore the register state from the ucontext
7493              pointed to by ARG1.
7494     
7495           Hey, it's uggerly.  But at least it's documented.
7496        */
7497        /* But in the meantime ... */
7498        VG_(debugLog)(0, "syswrap-darwin",
7499                         "WARNING: Ignoring sigreturn( uctx=..., 0 );\n");
7500        VG_(debugLog)(0, "syswrap-darwin",
7501                         "WARNING: Thread/program/Valgrind "
7502                         "will likely segfault now.\n");
7503        VG_(debugLog)(0, "syswrap-darwin",
7504                         "WARNING: Please file a bug report at "
7505                         "http://www.valgrind.org.\n");
7506        SET_STATUS_Failure( VKI_ENOSYS );
7507     }
7508     
7509     
7510     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
7511        machine-dependent traps
7512        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
7513     
7514     #if defined(VGA_x86)
7515     static VexGuestX86SegDescr* alloc_zeroed_x86_LDT ( void )
7516     {
7517        Int nbytes = VEX_GUEST_X86_LDT_NENT * sizeof(VexGuestX86SegDescr);
7518        return VG_(arena_calloc)(VG_AR_CORE, "syswrap-darwin.ldt", nbytes, 1);
7519     }
7520     #endif
7521     
7522     PRE(thread_fast_set_cthread_self)
7523     {
7524        PRINT("thread_fast_set_cthread_self ( %#lx )", ARG1);
7525        PRE_REG_READ1(void, "thread_fast_set_cthread_self", struct pthread_t *, self);
7526     
7527     #if defined(VGA_x86)
7528        // Point the USER_CTHREAD ldt entry (slot 6, reg 0x37) at this pthread
7529        {
7530           VexGuestX86SegDescr *ldt;
7531           ThreadState *tst = VG_(get_ThreadState)(tid);
7532           ldt = (VexGuestX86SegDescr *)tst->arch.vex.guest_LDT;
7533           if (!ldt) {
7534              ldt = alloc_zeroed_x86_LDT();
7535              tst->arch.vex.guest_LDT = (HWord)ldt;
7536           }
7537           VG_(memset)(&ldt[6], 0, sizeof(ldt[6]));
7538           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.LimitLow = 1;
7539           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.LimitHi = 0;
7540           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.BaseLow = ARG1 & 0xffff;
7541           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.BaseMid = (ARG1 >> 16) & 0xff;
7542           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.BaseHi = (ARG1 >> 24) & 0xff;
7543           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.Pres = 1; // ACC_P
7544           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.Dpl = 3; // ACC_PL_U
7545           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.Type = 0x12; // ACC_DATA_W
7546           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.Granularity = 1;  // SZ_G
7547           ldt[6].LdtEnt.Bits.Default_Big = 1;  // SZ_32
7548           
7549           tst->os_state.pthread = ARG1;
7550           tst->arch.vex.guest_GS = 0x37;
7551     
7552           // What we would like to do is:
7553           //   SET_STATUS_Success(0x37);
7554           // but that doesn't work, because this is a MDEP-class syscall,
7555           // and SET_STATUS_Success creates a UNIX-class syscall result.
7556           // Hence we have to laboriously construct the full SysRes "by hand"
7557           // and use that to set the syscall return status.
7558           SET_STATUS_from_SysRes(
7559              VG_(mk_SysRes_x86_darwin)(
7560                 VG_DARWIN_SYSNO_CLASS(__NR_thread_fast_set_cthread_self),
7561                 False, 0, 0x37
7562              )
7563           );
7564        }
7565     
7566     #elif defined(VGA_amd64)
7567        // GrP fixme bigger hack than x86
7568        {
7569           ThreadState *tst = VG_(get_ThreadState)(tid);
7570           tst->os_state.pthread = ARG1;
7571           tst->arch.vex.guest_GS_0x60 = ARG1;
7572           // SET_STATUS_Success(0x60);
7573           // see comments on x86 case just above
7574           SET_STATUS_from_SysRes(
7575              VG_(mk_SysRes_amd64_darwin)(
7576                 VG_DARWIN_SYSNO_CLASS(__NR_thread_fast_set_cthread_self),
7577                 False, 0, 0x60
7578              )
7579           );
7580        }
7581     
7582     #else
7583     #error unknown architecture
7584     #endif
7585     }
7586     
7587     
7588     /* ---------------------------------------------------------------------
7589        syscall tables
7590        ------------------------------------------------------------------ */
7591     
7592     /* Add a Darwin-specific, arch-independent wrapper to a syscall table. */
7593     #define MACX_(sysno, name)    WRAPPER_ENTRY_X_(darwin, VG_DARWIN_SYSNO_INDEX(sysno), name) 
7594     #define MACXY(sysno, name)    WRAPPER_ENTRY_XY(darwin, VG_DARWIN_SYSNO_INDEX(sysno), name)
7595     #define _____(sysno) GENX_(sysno, sys_ni_syscall)
7596     
7597     /*
7598          _____ : unsupported by the kernel (sys_ni_syscall)
7599       // _____ : unimplemented in valgrind
7600          GEN   : handlers are in syswrap-generic.c
7601          MAC   : handlers are in this file
7602             X_ : PRE handler only
7603             XY : PRE and POST handlers
7604     */
7605     const SyscallTableEntry ML_(syscall_table)[] = {
7606     // _____(__NR_syscall),   // 0
7607        MACX_(__NR_exit,        exit), 
7608        GENX_(__NR_fork,        sys_fork), 
7609        GENXY(__NR_read,        sys_read), 
7610        GENX_(__NR_write,       sys_write), 
7611        GENXY(__NR_open,        sys_open), 
7612        GENXY(__NR_close,       sys_close), 
7613        GENXY(__NR_wait4,       sys_wait4), 
7614        _____(VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CONSTRUCT_UNIX(8)),     // old creat
7615        GENX_(__NR_link,        sys_link), 
7616        GENX_(__NR_unlink,      sys_unlink), 
7617        _____(VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CONSTRUCT_UNIX(11)),    // old execv
7618        GENX_(__NR_chdir,       sys_chdir), 
7619        GENX_(__NR_fchdir,      sys_fchdir), 
7620        GENX_(__NR_mknod,       sys_mknod), 
7621        GENX_(__NR_chmod,       sys_chmod), 
7622        GENX_(__NR_chown,       sys_chown), 
7623        _____(VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CONSTRUCT_UNIX(17)),    // old break
7624        MACXY(__NR_getfsstat,   getfsstat), 
7625        _____(VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CONSTRUCT_UNIX(19)),    // old lseek
7626        GENX_(__NR_getpid,      sys_getpid),     // 20
7627        _____(VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CONSTRUCT_UNIX(21)),    // old mount 
7628        _____(VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CONSTRUCT_UNIX(22)),    // old umount
7629        GENX_(__NR_setuid,      sys_setuid), 
7630        GENX_(__NR_getuid,      sys_getuid), 
7631        GENX_(__NR_geteuid,     sys_geteuid), 
7632        MACX_(__NR_ptrace,      ptrace), 
7633        MACXY(__NR_recvmsg,     recvmsg), 
7634        MACX_(__NR_sendmsg,     sendmsg), 
7635        MACXY(__NR_recvfrom,    recvfrom), 
7636        MACXY(__NR_accept,      accept), 
7637        MACXY(__NR_getpeername, getpeername), 
7638        MACXY(__NR_getsockname, getsockname), 
7639        GENX_(__NR_access,      sys_access), 
7640        MACX_(__NR_chflags,     chflags), 
7641        MACX_(__NR_fchflags,    fchflags), 
7642        GENX_(__NR_sync,        sys_sync), 
7643        GENX_(__NR_kill,        sys_kill), 
7644        _____(VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CONSTRUCT_UNIX(38)),    // old stat
7645        GENX_(__NR_getppid,     sys_getppid), 
7646        _____(VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CONSTRUCT_UNIX(40)),    // old lstat
7647        GENXY(__NR_dup,         sys_dup), 
7648        MACXY(__NR_pipe,        pipe), 
7649        GENX_(__NR_getegid,     sys_getegid), 
7650     // _____(__NR_profil), 
7651        _____(VG_DARWIN_SYSCALL_CONSTRUCT_UNIX(45)),    // old ktrace
7652        MACXY(__NR_sigaction,   sigaction),
